translated: Alternatively, grind shingngar, shingkun, shugpa, gya phempo, shi risha, sgo khyam, and ruta in goat urine, and insert the strained liquid into the nose.

original: mig tu bsku bar bya'o /
analyzed: mig tu bsku bar bya'o /

original: // / smyo byed kyis thebs pa la /

analyzed: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsdigs la de'i 'og tu tshig 'jam pos gzhom par bya'o //

original: glo bur las gyur pa'i smyo byed kyi nad kyis thebs pa la ni /
analyzed: glo bur las gyur pa'i smyo byed kyi nad kyis thebs pa la ni /
translated: For those afflicted by a temporary insanity,

analyzed: sman pa gtsang zhing re ba med pas mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / bshos dang / mchod sbyin dang / sbyin sreg dang / sngags dang / mig tu bsku ba dang / snar blugs pa la sogs pa'i cho ga ji lta ba bzhin du bsal bar bya'o /
translated: they should be cured by a pure doctor who has no hope of reward, through the proper performance of rituals such as offerings, bali offerings, meals, sacrifices, fire offerings, mantras, eye medicine, and nasal medication.

analyzed: // / da ni brjed byed kyi bye brag bshad par bya ste / brjed byed ni /
translated: Now, the different types of epilepsy will be explained.🔽Epilepsy

analyzed: mun pa 'dra bas sems non nas nad gzhi shas cher 'khrugs pa las dran pa nyams shing khro bar gyur pa la brjed byed kyi nad ces bya'o //
translated: is when the mind is oppressed by something like darkness, and due to the disturbance of the humors, memory is impaired and one becomes angry. This is called the disease of epilepsy.

analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi ste ma rungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known that there are four types of this.

analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni /

analyzed: mdog gnag pa dang / ser ba dang / dkar ba rnams yin @253a * //
translated: black, yellow, and white, respectively.

analyzed: te go rim bzhin du sbyar ba dang / ci mthong ngo cog kyang de dag so so'i rnam pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: Whatever one sees is seen in the form of each of them.

analyzed: nad gzhi gsum car 'dus pa las gyur pa'i brjed byed kyi nad ni mtshan ma thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The disease of forgetfulness that arises from the combination of all three humors has all the signs.

original: gso dka' ba yin pas de dag la thog mar ni bkru sman drag po mas btang ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtang ba dang / skyug sman btang ba dang / bkru sman btang ba dang / sman snar blugs pa dang / cho ga rnam pa lnga po 'di rnams nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gso dka' ba yin pas de dag la thog mar ni bkru sman drag po mas btang ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtang ba dang / skyug sman btang ba dang / bkru sman btang ba dang / sman snar blugs pa dang / cho ga rnam pa lnga po 'di rnams nad gzhi ji lta ba bzhin du gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is difficult to cure, one should first administer the five procedures: strong purgation, unctuous enema, emetic, strong purgation, and nasal medication, according to the disease.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa la ni bkru sman drag po mas btang ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas btang bar bya'o //🔽mkhris pa las gyur pa la ni bkru sman btang ngo //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa la ni bkru sman drag po mas btang ba dang / 'jam rtsi mas btang bar bya'o // mkhris pa las gyur pa la ni bkru sman btang ngo //
translated: For those caused by wind, administer strong emetic medicine and unctuous enemas.🔽For those caused by bile, administer emetic medicine.

original: bad kan las gyur pa la ni skyug sman btang ngo //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa la ni skyug sman btang ngo //
translated: For those caused by phlegm, administer emetic medicine.

original: sman snar blugs pa ni so so'i sman las sbyar na kun la yang phan no //
analyzed: sman snar blugs pa ni so so'i sman las sbyar na kun la yang phan no //
translated: For all, it is beneficial to administer medicine in the nose according to the individual medicine.

original: kun 'dus pa las gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: kun 'dus pa las gyur pa la ni /
translated: For those caused by a combination of all,

original: gang shas che ba dang yang sbyar zhing cho ga de rnams las gang 'os pa gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang shas che ba dang yang sbyar zhing cho ga de rnams las gang 'os pa gtang bar bya'o //
translated: apply whatever is most prominent and administer whatever is appropriate from those rituals.

original: cho ga de dag gis lus rab tu dag par gyur nas /
analyzed: cho ga de dag gis lus rab tu dag par gyur nas /
translated: When the body has become completely purified through those rituals,

original: de'i 'og tu ni smyo byed kyi nad bsal ba'i cho ga sngar bstan pa bzhin du bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni smyo byed kyi nad bsal ba'i cho ga sngar bstan pa bzhin du bya'o ;
translated: then the ritual for dispelling insanity should be performed as previously taught.

original: / yang na sman shad ka pu shi pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma sman bram mhi khu ba dang / mar rnying pa lo du ma lon pa'i nang du skol la mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ci ran par 'thungs na brjed byed dang /🔽smyo byed can sel zhing yid gzhungs par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: / yang na sman shad ka pu shi pa dang / shu dag dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma sman bram mhi khu ba dang / mar rnying pa lo du ma lon pa'i nang du skol la mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ci ran par 'thungs na brjed byed dang / smyo byed can sel zhing yid gzhungs par byed pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: Alternatively, one should boil a powder of śyāmāka grain, śaṅkha grain, and barley, with the juice of brahmi and old ghee that is several years old. After straining, one should drink as much as is appropriate. This is the best for curing senility and insanity and for enhancing intelligence.

original: mar dang til mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / 'o ma mar gyi bcu drug gi nang du 'tsho byed ces bya ba'i sman sna bco lngar bshad pa rnams kyi phye ma srang re re skol la mar dang til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ran par 'thungs na yang brjed byed kyi nad sel to //
analyzed: mar dang til mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / 'o ma mar gyi bcu drug gi nang du 'tsho byed ces bya ba'i sman sna bco lngar bshad pa rnams kyi phye ma srang re re skol la mar dang til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ran par 'thungs na yang brjed byed kyi nad sel to //
translated: One should boil thirty-two ounces of ghee and sesame oil, and sixteen ounces of milk, with a powder of each of the fifteen herbs called “life-sustaining.” After straining, one should drink as much as is appropriate. This also cures senility.

original: shing kru dang / ru rta dang / ldong ros dang / go snyod dang / sgog skya dang / tsha ba gsum dang / shing kun rnams kyi phye ma ra gcin dang / til mar gyi nang du skol ba'i mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te snar blugs na yang @253b brjed byed kyi nad sel to //
analyzed: shing kru dang / ru rta dang / ldong ros dang / go snyod dang / sgog skya dang / tsha ba gsum dang / shing kun rnams kyi phye ma ra gcin dang / til mar gyi nang du skol ba'i mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te snar blugs na yang @253b brjed byed kyi nad sel to //
translated: The powder of kru, ruta, long-pepper, asafoetida, garlic, the three hot spices, and devadaru, boiled in goat urine and sesame oil, strained and inserted into the nose, also cures epilepsy.

original: smyo byed kyi nad dang / brjed byed kyi nang la /
analyzed: smyo byed kyi nad dang / brjed byed kyi nang la /
translated: In the case of insanity and epilepsy,

original: chu dang / me dang / shing dang / brag la sogs pa gnas ngan pa rnams ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / shing dang / brag la sogs pa gnas ngan pa rnams ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: one should avoid bad places such as water, fire, trees, rocks, and so forth.

original: sems gsal zhing yid gzhungs par 'gyur ba'i sman bcud kyis len ni bsgrims te rtag tu bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems gsal zhing yid gzhungs par 'gyur ba'i sman bcud kyis len ni bsgrims te rtag tu bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should carefully and constantly take nourishing medicine that clarifies the mind and sharpens the memory.

original: smyo byed dang / brjed byed kyi nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: smyo byed dang / brjed byed kyi nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twentieth chapter, on the treatment of insanity and epilepsy.

original: // / de nas rlung nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas rlung nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of wind disorders will be explained.

original: rlung nad rnam pa brgyad cu ni /
analyzed: rlung nad rnam pa brgyad cu ni /
translated: There are eighty types of wind disorders,

original: rlung 'khrugs pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rlung 'khrugs pa las 'byung ste /
translated: arising from disturbed wind.

original: de rnams spyi'i mtshan ma ni na ba dang / yan lag chag pa snyam byed pa dang / zug pa dang / yan lag 'khums pa dang / sha skam pa dang / drag tu btsir ba 'dra bar na ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: de rnams spyi'i mtshan ma ni na ba dang / yan lag chag pa snyam byed pa dang / zug pa dang / yan lag 'khums pa dang / sha skam pa dang / drag tu btsir ba 'dra bar na ba rnams yin no //
translated: The general symptoms of these are: pain, feeling as if a limb is broken, aching, limb-contraction, muscle-wasting, and pain as if strongly squeezed.

analyzed: de la rlung nad dam po zhes bya ba ni rang dbang med par lus 'gul ba yin no //
translated: Among these, the so-called “stiff wind” is an involuntary shaking of the body.

original: rlung nad sgur po gzhu 'khums bzhin du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: rlung nad sgur po gzhu 'khums bzhin du 'dug pa'o //
translated: The “bent wind” is a bending like a bow.

original: rlung nad gzhogs phyed na ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung nad gzhogs phyed na ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called “half-sided wind” causes pain on one side of the body.

original: lus kyi gzhogs phyed ril gyis na bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gzhogs phyed ril gyis na bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes pain in the whole of one side of the body.

original: rlung nad lag pa ya gcig 'jes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung nad lag pa ya gcig 'jes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called “stiffened one-sided wind” causes the hand to be stiff.

original: rlung gis phrag pa'i rtsa 'khums par byas pa yin par shes par bya'o //🔽rlung nad dpyi mig man chad zug pa'i nad ni /
analyzed: rlung gis phrag pa'i rtsa 'khums par byas pa yin par shes par bya'o // rlung nad dpyi mig man chad zug pa'i nad ni /

original: brla man chad du na ste /🔽brkyang bskum mi nus shing /
analyzed: brla man chad du na ste / brkyang bskum mi nus shing /
translated: The so-called “wind-pain below the hip-socket” causes pain below the thigh.

original: rting pa nas sor mo'i bar du na zhing 'gro mi shes par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rting pa nas sor mo'i bar du na zhing 'gro mi shes par byas pa yin no //
translated: It causes pain from the heel to the toes, and one is unable to walk.

original: rlung nad kha yon zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung nad kha yon zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called “crooked mouth” wind disorder

original: rlung gis kha phyogs gcig tu yo bar byas pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: rlung gis kha phyogs gcig tu yo bar byas pa yin par bshad do //
translated: is explained as being caused by the wind shifting in one direction.

original: rlung nad pus mo skrangs ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung nad pus mo skrangs ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called “swollen knee” wind disorder

analyzed: rlung dang khrag rgyas pas pus mo'i lha nga skrangs par byed pa yin no //
translated: is caused by the wind and blood spreading and causing swelling of the kneecaps.

original: de la sman mar gyis lus bsku ba dang / dugs bya ba dang / sman mas btang ba dang snar blugs pa dang / snum gyis bkru sman btang ba dang / kha zas snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / mngar ba dang /
analyzed: de la sman mar gyis lus bsku ba dang / dugs bya ba dang / sman mas btang ba dang snar blugs pa dang / snum gyis bkru sman btang ba dang / kha zas snum pa dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / mngar ba dang /
translated: In that case, anointing the body with medicinal butter, applying compresses, administering medicinal enemas, nasal medication, oil-based purgation, oily, sour, salty, and sweet foods,

analyzed: ro tsa bar byed pa'i bag rnams ni rlung nad sel to // sman ba la dang / se ri ya gang yang rung ba skol ba'i khu ba'i nang du de nyid kyi phye ma /
translated: and the use of astringents will cure wind disorders.🔽Boil either the physician’s plant or the Indian valerian in water.

original: til mar dang 'o ma lhan cig tu bskol la /
analyzed: til mar dang 'o ma lhan cig tu bskol la /
translated: Add the powder of the same plant to the liquid, together with sesame oil and milk.

original: til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te 'thungs na /🔽rlung @254a * //
analyzed: til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te 'thungs na / rlung @254a * //
translated: Filter the liquid, leaving only the oil, and drink it.

original: nad kyi sna grangs thams cad sel to //
analyzed: nad kyi sna grangs thams cad sel to //
translated: This will cure all types of wind disorders.

original: yang na / til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / sman aa shva gandha srang lnga bcu skol ba'i khu ba mar gyi bzhi 'gyur gyi nang du /
analyzed: yang na / til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / sman aa shva gandha srang lnga bcu skol ba'i khu ba mar gyi bzhi 'gyur gyi nang du /
translated: Alternatively, one should boil thirty-two ounces of sesame oil, milk, and fifty ounces of the medicine aśvagandha in a decoction of four times the amount of butter.

original: spang spos dang / shing tsa dang / gandha pa tra dang / btsod dang / tra banti dang / byi'u rug pa dang / dz'a ti dang / ba la dang / thang shing dang / sti ra dang / shing mngar dang / ra sna dang /
analyzed: spang spos dang / shing tsa dang / gandha pa tra dang / btsod dang / tra banti dang / byi'u rug pa dang / dz'a ti dang / ba la dang / thang shing dang / sti ra dang / shing mngar dang / ra sna dang /
translated: Add to this a mixture of one ounce each of spang spos, shing tsa, gandhapatra, tsor, travanti, byi rug pa, jati, bala, thangshen, tira, shing ngar, ra sna,

original: sug smel dang / ma nu dang / shu dag dang / gze ma dang / ru rta dang / pu ti ka dang / shu ti dang / pudna na ba dang / pram ha t'i dang / pu shel tse dang / bi ra ri rnams btags pa'i phye ma zho gnyis gnyis lhan cig tu bskol te til mar 'ba' zhig lus pa btsags pa'i ming ni aa shva ganda la sogs pa'i til mar zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sug smel dang / ma nu dang / shu dag dang / gze ma dang / ru rta dang / pu ti ka dang / shu ti dang / pudna na ba dang / pram ha t'i dang / pu shel tse dang / bi ra ri rnams btags pa'i phye ma zho gnyis gnyis lhan cig tu bskol te til mar 'ba' zhig lus pa btsags pa'i ming ni aa shva ganda la sogs pa'i til mar zhes bya ste /
translated: sugmel, manu, shudag, zema, ruta, puti ka, shuti, pundanava, praṃhatī, pushpel tse, and vira. Boil this mixture of two ounces of each ingredient together. When only the sesame oil remains, strain it. This is called “sesame oil of aśvagandha and so forth.”

original: btung ba dang / lus bsku ba dang / snar blugs pa dang / mas btang ba rnam pa bzhi po dag tu sbyar na rlung nad thams cad sel to //
analyzed: btung ba dang / lus bsku ba dang / snar blugs pa dang / mas btang ba rnam pa bzhi po dag tu sbyar na rlung nad thams cad sel to //
translated: When applied in the four ways—drinking, bathing, nasal medication, and enema—it cures all wind disorders.

original: til mar dang / la phug gi khu ba srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / zho dang / rtsabs skyur po dang / 'o ma rnams las re re yang til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur bzhi 'gyur dang / 'di rnams kyi nang du /
analyzed: til mar dang / la phug gi khu ba srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / zho dang / rtsabs skyur po dang / 'o ma rnams las re re yang til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur bzhi 'gyur dang / 'di rnams kyi nang du /
translated: Take thirty-two ounces each of sesame oil and radish juice, curd, sour gruel, and milk, each of which is four times the amount of sesame oil.

original: shu dag dang / ba la dang / ra sna dang / ma nu dang / bca' sga dang / kru trug tres dang / shi kru dang / rgyam tsha dang / gze ma dang / pi pi ling rnams kyi phye ma skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa'i til mar gyi sman yang rlung nad kyis nyam thag pa thams cad sel ba yin no //
analyzed: shu dag dang / ba la dang / ra sna dang / ma nu dang / bca' sga dang / kru trug tres dang / shi kru dang / rgyam tsha dang / gze ma dang / pi pi ling rnams kyi phye ma skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa'i til mar gyi sman yang rlung nad kyis nyam thag pa thams cad sel ba yin no //
translated: Boil in this mixture the powders of cumin, bala, rasna, mansi, asafetida, krutakra, shigru, rock salt, ginger, and long pepper. Strain the sesame oil that remains after boiling. This medicinal sesame oil cures all those afflicted by wind disorders.

original: til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / sman pra sa ra ni srang brgya skol ba'i khu ba til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur dang / 'di rnams kyi nang du sman dzi ba ka dang / ri sha bha ka dang /
analyzed: til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / sman pra sa ra ni srang brgya skol ba'i khu ba til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur dang / 'di rnams kyi nang du sman dzi ba ka dang / ri sha bha ka dang /
translated: Thirty-two drams of sesame oil and milk, and a decoction of one hundred drams of prasarana, four times the amount of sesame oil,🔽and in these, the powders of jivaka, rishabhaka,

original: me da rnam gnyis dang / bu tshad rtong dang / ra mnye dang / ru rta dang / tsan dan rnam gnyis dang / shu ti dang / thang shing dang / btsod dang / ra sna rnams kyi phye ma skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa 'di las mas btang ba la sogs par sbyar na yang rlung sel to //
analyzed: me da rnam gnyis dang / bu tshad rtong dang / ra mnye dang / ru rta dang / tsan dan rnam gnyis dang / shu ti dang / thang shing dang / btsod dang / ra sna rnams kyi phye ma skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa 'di las mas btang ba la sogs par sbyar na yang rlung sel to //
translated: the two medas, the two butchers, ramnyae, ruta, the two candanas, shuti, pine, red buckthorn, and goat horn, are boiled. This sesame oil, boiled until only half remains, is strained. If applied as an enema and so forth, it also removes vata.

original: til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / @254b gze ma'i khu ba til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur gyi nang du bu ram dang / bca' sga'i phye ma srang brgyad brgyad lhan cig tu skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ran par 'thungs pa'i 'og tu 'o ma 'thungs la thur du 'khrus pa chod pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: til mar dang / 'o ma srang sum cu rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / @254b gze ma'i khu ba til mar gyi bzhi 'gyur gyi nang du bu ram dang / bca' sga'i phye ma srang brgyad brgyad lhan cig tu skol la til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags te ran par 'thungs pa'i 'og tu 'o ma 'thungs la thur du 'khrus pa chod pa'i rjes la /
translated: Take thirty-two ounces each of sesame oil and milk, and in a quantity of sesame oil equal to one-fourth of the above, boil eight ounces each of molasses and ginger powder. Drink the oil when it is lukewarm, and after it has been digested, drink milk.

original: bca' sga dang bu ram sbyar ba zos nas sman snga ma btang ba dang / zhu bar gyur pa'i 'og tu kha zas 'o ma dang lhan cig tu zos na rlung nad mi bzad pa thams cad sel to //
analyzed: bca' sga dang bu ram sbyar ba zos nas sman snga ma btang ba dang / zhu bar gyur pa'i 'og tu kha zas 'o ma dang lhan cig tu zos na rlung nad mi bzad pa thams cad sel to //

original: bya'o // yang na rting pa nas sor bcu gnyis kyi gong du byin pa dral te byin pa'i nang na tshil gyi rmen bu nya'i sgo nga 'dra ba 'dug pa rnams phyung la /
analyzed: bya'o // yang na rting pa nas sor bcu gnyis kyi gong du byin pa dral te byin pa'i nang na tshil gyi rmen bu nya'i sgo nga 'dra ba 'dug pa rnams phyung la /
translated: Or, open the goiter twelve finger-widths above the heel. Remove the goiter, which is like a fish egg, from inside the goiter.

original: rma kha bsregs te rma gso ba'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rma kha bsregs te rma gso ba'i cho ga bzhin du bya'o //
translated: It should be treated like a cauterized wound.

original: sha rmen ni nad gzhi gsum so so las gyur te khrag dang sha dang tshil rnams kyi rmen bu yin no //
analyzed: sha rmen ni nad gzhi gsum so so las gyur te khrag dang sha dang tshil rnams kyi rmen bu yin no //
translated: A polyp is caused by three different conditions: blood, flesh, and fat.

original: de ni nad gzhi so so'i mtshan ma las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni nad gzhi so so'i mtshan ma las shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be diagnosed by the signs of each condition.

original: de la khrag dang sha las gyur ba'i sha rmen ni /
analyzed: de la khrag dang sha las gyur ba'i sha rmen ni /
translated: A polyp caused by blood and flesh

original: gsor mi rung ngo //🔽sha rmen gso ba'i thabs ni /
analyzed: gsor mi rung ngo // sha rmen gso ba'i thabs ni /
translated: is incurable.🔽The treatment for a polyp

original: lba ba gso ba'i cho gar bshad pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: lba ba gso ba'i cho gar bshad pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: is as explained in the treatment of goiter.

original: yang na dral ba dang / bsreg pa dang / sman gyi thal bas gdab pa rnams kyang bya zhing /
analyzed: yang na dral ba dang / bsreg pa dang / sman gyi thal bas gdab pa rnams kyang bya zhing /
translated: Alternatively, it should be split, burned, and sprinkled with medicinal ash.

original: ras ma'am lo mas g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ras ma'am lo mas g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be covered with a cloth or a leaf.

original: skrangs pa'i nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: skrangs pa'i nad gso ba'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twenty-fourth chapter, on the treatment of swelling, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / @260b de nas rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / @260b de nas rma gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of wounds will be explained.

original: rma ni lus nyid las 'byung ba dang / glo bur du 'byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rma ni lus nyid las 'byung ba dang / glo bur du 'byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: A wound should be understood as having two types, based on the distinction of whether it arises from the body itself or occurs suddenly.

original: de la snga ma ni nad gzhi rnams las gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni nad gzhi rnams las gyur pa yin no //
translated: The former is due to illness.

original: phyi ma ni mtshon la sogs pas rmas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni mtshon la sogs pas rmas pa yin no //
translated: The latter is due to being wounded by weapons and so on.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound due to wind are

original: rma'i nye skor rtsub cing mdog dmar la sngo skyar 'dug pa dang / 'dzag pa nyung zhing 'dar ba dang / cher mi na ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rma'i nye skor rtsub cing mdog dmar la sngo skyar 'dug pa dang / 'dzag pa nyung zhing 'dar ba dang / cher mi na ba rnams yin no //
translated: that the area around the wound is rough, red, and pale, there is little discharge, it shakes, and it is not very painful.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound due to bile are

original: rma dang nye skor gyi mdog ser zhing dmar la sngo ba dang / 'dzag pa che ba dang / lus tsha ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: rma dang nye skor gyi mdog ser zhing dmar la sngo ba dang / 'dzag pa che ba dang / lus tsha ba rnams yin no //
translated: that the color of the wound and its area is yellow, red, and blue, there is a lot of discharge, and the body is hot.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound due to phlegm are

original: mkhrang zhing dbal skya ba dang / chu ser skya bo 'dzag cing grang la bska ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: mkhrang zhing dbal skya ba dang / chu ser skya bo 'dzag cing grang la bska ba rnams yin no //
translated: that it is firm and pale, there is a discharge of pale lymph, and it is cold and astringent.

original: khrag nad las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: khrag nad las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound caused by blood disorders are:

original: mdog dmar zhing khrag 'dzag pa yin no //
analyzed: mdog dmar zhing khrag 'dzag pa yin no //
translated: red color and bleeding.

original: nad gzhi gnyis 'dus pa las gyur pa dang / gsum 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni gang dang gang 'dus pa de dang de'i mtshan ma 'dres pas bstan to //
analyzed: nad gzhi gnyis 'dus pa las gyur pa dang / gsum 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rma'i mtshan ma ni gang dang gang 'dus pa de dang de'i mtshan ma 'dres pas bstan to //
translated: The signs of a wound caused by a combination of two or three disorders are taught by the combination of the signs of each one.

original: de la thog ma ma smin pa'i tshe ni /
analyzed: de la thog ma ma smin pa'i tshe ni /
translated: At first, when it is not ripe,

original: zhi bar 'gyur ba'i nan rtsis bsku'o //
analyzed: zhi bar 'gyur ba'i nan rtsis bsku'o //
translated: one should apply a treatment to pacify it.

original: rnag tu cha ba la ni smin par bya ba'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: rnag tu cha ba la ni smin par bya ba'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: When it is about to suppurate, one should perform the procedure to ripen it.

original: rnag zin pa la ni brtol te 'jib pa'i sman gyis rnag dang chu ser dag par bsal nas rma'i sha'u skye ba'i sman bya'o //
analyzed: rnag zin pa la ni brtol te 'jib pa'i sman gyis rnag dang chu ser dag par bsal nas rma'i sha'u skye ba'i sman bya'o //
translated: When it has suppurated, one should open it and remove the pus and lymph with a medicinal poultice, and then apply a medicine to promote the growth of new flesh.

original: de la rnag par bya ba'i sman ni /
analyzed: de la rnag par bya ba'i sman ni /
translated: The medicine to cause suppuration is:

original: til dang / phabs dang / zar ma dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma dang / phye dang rgyam tsha rnams zho skyur po dang sbyar te /
analyzed: til dang / phabs dang / zar ma dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma dang / phye dang rgyam tsha rnams zho skyur po dang sbyar te /
translated: a powder of sesame, yeast, linseed, and asafoetida, and a powder of salt and black salt mixed with sour curd.

original: brdzis pa'i gong bu ni smin par byed pa'i mchog yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: brdzis pa'i gong bu ni smin par byed pa'i mchog yin par 'dod do //
translated: The lump that is crushed is considered the best for ripening.

original: de la rnag tu tsha ba'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: de la rnag tu tsha ba'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of suppuration are as follows:

original: tshab 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / na zhing zug pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang skrangs pa rnams yin par bshad do //
analyzed: tshab 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa dang / na zhing zug pa dang / mdog dmar ba dang skrangs pa rnams yin par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that the signs of suppuration are bubbling, pain, redness, and swelling.

original: rnag pa'i mtshan ma ni gong ma smin du che ba'i mtshan ma rnams rtse gzhil bar 'gyur la /🔽gnyer ma 'dus shing phyogs gcig tu mthon po cog cog @261a * //
analyzed: rnag pa'i mtshan ma ni gong ma smin du che ba'i mtshan ma rnams rtse gzhil bar 'gyur la / gnyer ma 'dus shing phyogs gcig tu mthon po cog cog @261a * //
translated: The signs of pus are the opposite of the signs of imminent ripening mentioned above.

original: por 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: por 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The signs of pus are that the swelling subsides, wrinkles gather, and one side becomes higher than the other.

original: rdol bar bya ba'i sman ni /
analyzed: rdol bar bya ba'i sman ni /
translated: The medicine for bursting is as follows:

original: shing nye rong dang / snu ha kshi ra dang / aasmari dang / tsi ri bil ba la sogs pa'i sde tshan dang / kru trug tres dang / thi ba dang / bya gag dang / mchil pa'i rtug pa rnams kyi phye ma sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: shing nye rong dang / snu ha kshi ra dang / aasmari dang / tsi ri bil ba la sogs pa'i sde tshan dang / kru trug tres dang / thi ba dang / bya gag dang / mchil pa'i rtug pa rnams kyi phye ma sbyar ba'am /
translated: A mixture of the group of trees such as the neem tree, snuha, kshira, asmari, and chirvilab, and the powder of the feces of a pigeon, a dove, a cock, and a sparrow, or

original: yang na mu ska'i thal ba'i sman sbyar bas bsku ba ni rdol bar bya ba'i sman gyi nang na mchog yin no //
analyzed: yang na mu ska'i thal ba'i sman sbyar bas bsku ba ni rdol bar bya ba'i sman gyi nang na mchog yin no //
translated: Alternatively, applying a medicinal paste of mustard ash is the best among medicines for bursting boils.

original: 'jib pa'i sman gyis rnag dang chu ser bsal ba'i thabs ni /
analyzed: 'jib pa'i sman gyis rnag dang chu ser bsal ba'i thabs ni /
translated: The method of removing pus and lymph with a sucking medicine is as follows:

original: til dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing mngar dang / nimpa'i lo ma dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shing nye rong rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: til dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing mngar dang / nimpa'i lo ma dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shing nye rong rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Mix sesame, salt, sweet flag, neem leaves, turmeric, bamboo seeds, and neem tree powders with ghee and apply it.

original: yang na nimpa ba tra dang / til gyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na yang rma sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na nimpa ba tra dang / til gyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na yang rma sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Alternatively, apply neem leaf powder mixed with honey. It also cleans wounds.

original: rma'i sha'u skye ba'i sman ni /🔽nas rjen par btags pa'i phye ma /
analyzed: rma'i sha'u skye ba'i sman ni / nas rjen par btags pa'i phye ma /
translated: The medicine for the growth of wound flesh is as follows:🔽Grind raw barley into powder.

original: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mix it with ghee and honey and apply it. The wound will heal.

original: rma rub pa'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: rma rub pa'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a wound healing are as follows:

original: skrangs pa med la 'jam zhing snum pa dang / lce'i mdog 'dra bar dmar ba dang / na ba med cing 'dzag pa chad pa dang / rlob med pa rnams yin te rma dag par 'gyur ba'i rtags su bshad do //
analyzed: skrangs pa med la 'jam zhing snum pa dang / lce'i mdog 'dra bar dmar ba dang / na ba med cing 'dzag pa chad pa dang / rlob med pa rnams yin te rma dag par 'gyur ba'i rtags su bshad do //
translated: The signs of a healed wound are that it is not swollen, smooth, and shiny; the same color as the tongue, red; not painful, and the bleeding has stopped; and it is not raised.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni sman rtsa ba lnga pa'i sde tshan che chung gnyis cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i sde tshan cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni sman rtsa ba lnga pa'i sde tshan che chung gnyis cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o // mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rma la ni shing n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i sde tshan cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a wound caused by wind, the two groups of five root medicines, the major and the minor, should be used in all the procedures.🔽In the case of a wound caused by bile, the group of medicines such as nyagrodha should be used in all the procedures.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma la ni dong ga la sogs pa'i sde tshan cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i rma la ni dong ga la sogs pa'i sde tshan cho ga thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a wound caused by phlegm, the group of medicines such as dongka should be used in all the procedures.

original: yang autpal sngon po dang / ba la dang / skyer pa dang / med dang / shing mngar dang / tsan dan dang / sa mangga dang / dha ta ki rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te bskus na yang rma'i sha'u skye bar byed do //
analyzed: yang autpal sngon po dang / ba la dang / skyer pa dang / med dang / shing mngar dang / tsan dan dang / sa mangga dang / dha ta ki rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te bskus na yang rma'i sha'u skye bar byed do //
translated: Also, if one anoints with a paste of blue lotus, bala, bamboo, meda, sweet wood, sandalwood, earth, and dhataki, mixed with ghee, it will cause the growth of flesh in the wound.

original: yang na shing 'o ma can gyi myu gu'i phye ma mar dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na shing 'o ma can gyi myu gu'i phye ma mar dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, one should anoint with a paste of milk tree sprouts mixed with ghee.

original: yang na 'bras bu gsum dang / shing ba ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang / seng ldeng dang / seng phrom rnams @261b kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar bas bskus na rma kha 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu gsum dang / shing ba ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang / seng ldeng dang / seng phrom rnams @261b kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar bas bskus na rma kha 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, one should anoint with a paste of the three fruits, the tip of a banyan branch, kashmari, and sengdeng, mixed with ghee. This will close the wound.

original: yang na shing aardzu na dang / au du ma b'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / seng phrom dang / dzam b'u'i shun lpags dang / shing mngar dang / katpa la dang / rgya skyegs rnams kyi phye mas btab pa na yang /
analyzed: yang na shing aardzu na dang / au du ma b'a ra dang / aa shvadtha dang / seng phrom dang / dzam b'u'i shun lpags dang / shing mngar dang / katpa la dang / rgya skyegs rnams kyi phye mas btab pa na yang /
translated: Alternatively, if one applies a paste of arjuna, udumbara, ashvattha, kashmari, jambul bark, sweet wood, katphala, and lac,

original: rma'i sha'u skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rma'i sha'u skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it will cause the growth of flesh in the wound.

original: pu tse shel dang / spra tshil dang / yung dang / shing mngar dang / nakta ma la'i 'bras bu dang / lo ma dang / ma la ti dang / nimpa'i lo ma rnams kyi phye ma mar dang chu'i nang du bskol te /
analyzed: pu tse shel dang / spra tshil dang / yung dang / shing mngar dang / nakta ma la'i 'bras bu dang / lo ma dang / ma la ti dang / nimpa'i lo ma rnams kyi phye ma mar dang chu'i nang du bskol te /
translated: The powder of pucchaka, beeswax, turmeric, sweet wood, naktamala fruit, leaf, malati, and neem leaves, boiled in ghee and water,

original: mar nyi tshe lus pa yang rma la phan pa yin no //
analyzed: mar nyi tshe lus pa yang rma la phan pa yin no //
translated: even the remaining ghee alone is beneficial for the wound.

original: yang na pra punda r'i ka dang / shing mngar dang / bu tshang rto dang / ra mnye dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma dang / shing 'o ma can bskol ba'i khu ba rnams til mar gyi nang du bskol te /
analyzed: yang na pra punda r'i ka dang / shing mngar dang / bu tshang rto dang / ra mnye dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma dang / shing 'o ma can bskol ba'i khu ba rnams til mar gyi nang du bskol te /
translated: Or the powder of prapunnarika, sweet wood, buccha, ramnya, and sandalwood, and the liquid boiled from milky wood, boiled in sesame oil,

original: til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa yang rma 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa yang rma 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: even the remaining sesame oil alone, when strained, heals the wound.

original: rma kha sman gyis bskus pa'i steng du /
analyzed: rma kha sman gyis bskus pa'i steng du /
translated: On top of the wound anointed with medicine,

original: shing ka ranydza dang / plaksha dang / dzam b'u la sogs pa'i lo mas glan la de'i steng du ras la sogs pas dkri ba ni bzang ste rma sbyong zhing 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: shing ka ranydza dang / plaksha dang / dzam b'u la sogs pa'i lo mas glan la de'i steng du ras la sogs pas dkri ba ni bzang ste rma sbyong zhing 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: cover with leaves of karanja, plaksha, jambu, and so on. Covering it with cloth and so on is good. It cleanses and heals the wound.

original: rma la 'bu zhugs pa la ni byi'u dug pa la sogs pa'i sde tshan sbyar bas rma kha dang rma'i nang du bskus na phan no //
analyzed: rma la 'bu zhugs pa la ni byi'u dug pa la sogs pa'i sde tshan sbyar bas rma kha dang rma'i nang du bskus na phan no //
translated: For wounds infested with maggots, applying a compound of bird droppings and so on to the wound and its surroundings is helpful.

original: rma sos pa'i mal shong du gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: rma sos pa'i mal shong du gyur pa la ni /
translated: For wounds that have healed but have become sunken,

original: sran ma dang / mon sran sde'u la sogs pa sran ma'i rigs rnams kyi lo ma'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba'am /🔽yang na shing tog ko sha'am /
analyzed: sran ma dang / mon sran sde'u la sogs pa sran ma'i rigs rnams kyi lo ma'i phye ma chu dang sbyar ba'am / yang na shing tog ko sha'am /
translated: apply a paste of powdered leaves of various legumes such as beans and lentils mixed with water,🔽or a paste of powdered jujube fruit or jujube wood mixed with water.

original: shing lbang ko btags pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar bas bskus na slar gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing lbang ko btags pa'i phye ma chu dang sbyar bas bskus na slar gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This will cause the wound to fill up again.

original: rma 'khyims pa la ni cho ga shes pas rma'i bag gar byung ba brtags te /
analyzed: rma 'khyims pa la ni cho ga shes pas rma'i bag gar byung ba brtags te /
translated: For wounds that have become constricted, a skilled physician should examine the wound for any constricting folds.

original: mtshon gyis dral la dag par bsal zhing /🔽rnag dang / chu ser 'jib pa'i sman gyis bskus te myang ba ste /
analyzed: mtshon gyis dral la dag par bsal zhing / rnag dang / chu ser 'jib pa'i sman gyis bskus te myang ba ste /
translated: He should cut them with a scalpel and remove them.🔽He should then apply a wound-purifying medicine and rinse the wound.

original: rma khar sha'u skye zhing 'drub pa'i sman la sogs pa rma'i cho ga thams cad rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rma khar sha'u skye zhing 'drub pa'i sman la sogs pa rma'i cho ga thams cad rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: He should then apply all the appropriate wound treatments, such as medicines to prevent the wound from closing and medicines to promote healing.

original: rdu ba khong na yod pa'i rma la ni /
analyzed: rdu ba khong na yod pa'i rma la ni /
translated: For wounds with pus inside,

original: rngu ba skam pas drangs te phyung la /
analyzed: rngu ba skam pas drangs te phyung la /
translated: If the wound is dry, draw out the pus and remove it.

original: rma gso ba'i sman gyi cho ga @262a * //
analyzed: rma gso ba'i sman gyi cho ga @262a * //
translated: Then, apply the ritual of the medicine for healing wounds.

original: bstan pa rim bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Do this in stages.

original: rma rnying ring du lon pa'i rkyen gyis sha zad cing skam par gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: rma rnying ring du lon pa'i rkyen gyis sha zad cing skam par gyur pa la ni /
translated: If the wound is old and the flesh has wasted away due to a long time,

original: sha rtas pa'i sman gyi cho ga yang bya zhing /
analyzed: sha rtas pa'i sman gyi cho ga yang bya zhing /
translated: apply the ritual of the medicine for nourishing the flesh.

original: rma yang gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: rma yang gso bar bya'o //
translated: Then, heal the wound.

original: rma rang pa la ni rma'i nye skor gtar zhing khrag dbyung ba dang / skyug sman dang bkru sman btang /
analyzed: rma rang pa la ni rma'i nye skor gtar zhing khrag dbyung ba dang / skyug sman dang bkru sman btang /
translated: If the wound is festering, perform venesection and bloodletting around the wound, and administer emetics and purgation.

original: glo bur gyi rma la rma byung ba'i mod la /
analyzed: glo bur gyi rma la rma byung ba'i mod la /
translated: For an accidental wound, as soon as it occurs,

original: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas bskus te bcings la /
analyzed: mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar bas bskus te bcings la /
translated: apply an ointment of ghee and honey, and bind it.

original: mkhris pa dang khrag gi drod tsha ba dbri zhing bsil ba'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa dang khrag gi drod tsha ba dbri zhing bsil ba'i cho ga rnams bya'o //
translated: Reduce the heat of bile and blood, and perform the ritual for cooling.

original: rus pa chag gam tshigs byung ba la ni /🔽cho ga shes pas srang zhing /
analyzed: rus pa chag gam tshigs byung ba la ni / cho ga shes pas srang zhing /
translated: If a bone is broken or dislocated,

original: tshigs bcug la /
analyzed: tshigs bcug la /
translated: a person who knows the ritual should set it.

original: mar dang shing mngar gyis bskus te bcings la ras kyis dam du dkris la /
analyzed: mar dang shing mngar gyis bskus te bcings la ras kyis dam du dkris la /
translated: Then, apply an ointment of ghee and sweet wood, bind it, and tightly bandage it with cloth.

original: shing 'o ma can gyi shun lpags kyis mi 'gul bar dbang du byas te ci nas kyang ma rnag par nan tan du bsrung bar bya'o //

translated: Mix the powder of any of the following with honey and apply it to the eyes: roasted barley flour, beer, the essence of madhuka wood, the husk of barberry, and salt.

original: yang na ga bur dang / na le sham dang / shing mngar dang / dung dang / ba lang gi so dang / rgyam tsha dang / ldong ros dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma shig gru'i khu ba dang sbyar te ri lur byas pas bskus na yang ling tog dkar po sel bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na ga bur dang / na le sham dang / shing mngar dang / dung dang / ba lang gi so dang / rgyam tsha dang / ldong ros dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma shig gru'i khu ba dang sbyar te ri lur byas pas bskus na yang ling tog dkar po sel bar byed do //
translated: Alternatively, make a pill from the powder of camphor, nut grass, sweet flag, conch, cowry, salt, realgar, and sandalwood, mixed with the juice of a jujube fruit. Rubbing this on the eyes will also remove white spots.

original: rgya mtsho'i lpu ba dang / khyim bya'i sgo nga'i shun lpags dang / rgyam tsha dang / dung dang / shi gru'i 'bras bu'i tshi gu rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te ri lur byas pas bskus na yang ling tog la sogs pa gris bzhogs pa bzhin du med par byed do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i lpu ba dang / khyim bya'i sgo nga'i shun lpags dang / rgyam tsha dang / dung dang / shi gru'i 'bras bu'i tshi gu rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te ri lur byas pas bskus na yang ling tog la sogs pa gris bzhogs pa bzhin du med par byed do //
translated: Grind the skin of a sea-monster, the skin of a chicken egg, salt, conch shell, and the husk of a śigru fruit together with water to make a paste. Rub it on the eyes, and it will remove cataracts and so forth as if they were cut with a knife.

original: khyim bya'i sgo nga'i shun lpags dang / ldong ros dang / dung dang / mching bu dang / tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma cha bsnyams pa'i steng du /
analyzed: khyim bya'i sgo nga'i shun lpags dang / ldong ros dang / dung dang / mching bu dang / tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma cha bsnyams pa'i steng du /
translated: Grind the skin of a chicken egg, red arsenic, conch shell, quartz, sandalwood, and salt together in equal parts.

original: mig sman gyi thur ma bsgres pas mig byug na yang /
analyzed: mig sman gyi thur ma bsgres pas mig byug na yang /
translated: Add an ointment stick to the mixture and use it to apply ointment to the eyes.

original: ling tog dang / mig 'dzer la sogs pa med par byed do //
analyzed: ling tog dang / mig 'dzer la sogs pa med par byed do //
translated: It will remove cataracts, eye boogers, and so forth.

original: tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha dang / aa ru ra dang / rgya skyegs rnams kyi phye ma yas kyi rim bzhin du dang po'i cha res bskyed de sbyar ba'i nang du mig sman gyi thur mas bsgres pas mig byug na yang ling tog dang /
analyzed: tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha dang / aa ru ra dang / rgya skyegs rnams kyi phye ma yas kyi rim bzhin du dang po'i cha res bskyed de sbyar ba'i nang du mig sman gyi thur mas bsgres pas mig byug na yang ling tog dang /
translated: Grind sandalwood, salt, yellow myrobalan and lac into a powder. Mix the first part of the powder with the first part of eye ointment. Mix the second part of the powder with the second part of eye ointment and so on. Rub this into the eyes with an eye ointment stick. It will remove cataracts,

original: mig @264b 'dzer la sogs pa med par byed do //
analyzed: mig @264b 'dzer la sogs pa med par byed do //
translated: eye floaters and so on.

original: sna ma'i me tog kha ma 'bus ba dang / rgya skyegs dang / btsag yug snam dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma cha mnyam la chu dang sbyar ba'i ri lus mig bskus na yang mig snad cing rma byung ba dang / ling tog rnams sel zhing khrag gis rgyas pa dang bar byed do //
analyzed: sna ma'i me tog kha ma 'bus ba dang / rgya skyegs dang / btsag yug snam dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma cha mnyam la chu dang sbyar ba'i ri lus mig bskus na yang mig snad cing rma byung ba dang / ling tog rnams sel zhing khrag gis rgyas pa dang bar byed do //
translated: Mix equal parts of unopened jasmine flowers, lac, madder and sandalwood with water. Make it into a pill and rub it into the eyes. It will remove eye injuries, wounds, cataracts and swelling.

original: ling tog dmar po la ni dung gi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: ling tog dmar po la ni dung gi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: For red cataracts, mix conch powder with honey.

original: ka ta ka'i 'bras bu rgyam tsha dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: ka ta ka'i 'bras bu rgyam tsha dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Or mix kataka fruit with salt.

original: rgya mtsho'i lbu ba kha ra dang sbyar ba rnams las gang yang rung bas mig byug par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i lbu ba kha ra dang sbyar ba rnams las gang yang rung bas mig byug par bya'o //
translated: One should apply any of these to the eyes.

original: sna ma'i lo ma'i khu ba dang sbrang rtsi dang / yung dang / skyer pa'i phye ma dang / skyer khanda rnams kyi mig sman nam /
analyzed: sna ma'i lo ma'i khu ba dang sbrang rtsi dang / yung dang / skyer pa'i phye ma dang / skyer khanda rnams kyi mig sman nam /
translated: One should apply to the eyes a collyrium of jasmine flower juice, honey, indigo, and the powders of the fruit of the Indian beech tree and of the Indian valerian.

original: yang na pi pi ling ras gtsang ma'i nang du phur te ba lang gi gci ba'i khu ba'i nang du btsos la skams pa'i phye mas mig byugs na /
analyzed: yang na pi pi ling ras gtsang ma'i nang du phur te ba lang gi gci ba'i khu ba'i nang du btsos la skams pa'i phye mas mig byugs na /
translated: Or, one should wrap a betel nut in a clean cloth, boil it in the juice of cow dung, and dry it. By applying the powder to the eyes,

original: mtshan mo mi mthong ba'i mig nad sel to //
analyzed: mtshan mo mi mthong ba'i mig nad sel to //
translated: one will cure eye diseases that cause blindness at night.

original: ldong ros dang / cu gang dang / stang zil dang / tsha ba gsum ba lang gi mkhris pas sbrus la /
analyzed: ldong ros dang / cu gang dang / stang zil dang / tsha ba gsum ba lang gi mkhris pas sbrus la /
translated: One should mix realgar, costus root, mica, and the three spices with cow’s bile.

original: sran tsam gyis reng reng po dril la /
analyzed: sran tsam gyis reng reng po dril la /
translated: Roll them into pills the size of peas.

original: chu las brdar ba'am /
analyzed: chu las brdar ba'am /
translated: Rub them in water,

original: yang na thang shing gi phye mar gcin gyis spang zhing skams pa de lta bur lan grangs mang du byas pas mig bskus na mig mchi mas gang ba sel to //
analyzed: yang na thang shing gi phye mar gcin gyis spang zhing skams pa de lta bur lan grangs mang du byas pas mig bskus na mig mchi mas gang ba sel to //
translated: or grind them with urine into a powder. By applying this to the eyes many times, one will cure the eyes when they are filled with tears.

original: yang na / ba bla dang / thang shing dang / shu dag rnams kyi phye ma bye'u rug pa'i lo ma'i khu ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na / ba bla dang / thang shing dang / shu dag rnams kyi phye ma bye'u rug pa'i lo ma'i khu ba dang sbyar te /
translated: Alternatively, one should make a pill from a powder of babla, pine, and shudag mixed with the juice of a ruka leaf.

original: ri lur byas la grib mar bskams bas mig bskus na yang mig tshag rnying sel to //
analyzed: ri lur byas la grib mar bskams bas mig bskus na yang mig tshag rnying sel to //
translated: If one smears the eyes with this, it will also remove old eye pain.

original: ba bla dang / stang zil dang / de gnyis bsdoms pa'i nyis 'gyur gyis zangs rnams zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma'i nang du /
analyzed: ba bla dang / stang zil dang / de gnyis bsdoms pa'i nyis 'gyur gyis zangs rnams zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma'i nang du /
translated: One should grind babla, turmeric, and double that amount of copper into a fine powder.

original: mig sman gyi thur ma bsgres pas mig byug gam /
analyzed: mig sman gyi thur ma bsgres pas mig byug gam /
translated: One should smear the eyes with this mixed with eye ointment.

original: yang na tsha ba gsum gyi phye ma dang / skyer khanda chu dang sbyar te bskus na yang mig tshag po sel to //
analyzed: yang na tsha ba gsum gyi phye ma dang / skyer khanda chu dang sbyar te bskus na yang mig tshag po sel to //
translated: Alternatively, if one smears the eyes with a powder of the three hot medicines mixed with kyerpö water, it will also remove eye pain.

original: mig nad rab rib tu gyur pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan ma ni shin tu zi zi por gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mig nad rab rib tu gyur pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan ma ni shin tu zi zi por gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //

original: so so'i bye brag gzhan yang bshad de /
analyzed: so so'i bye brag gzhan yang bshad de /

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of eye disease caused by bile are:

original: kha dog sngon po dang / ser por snang zhing /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser por snang zhing /

original: me 'bar ba dang / srin bu me khyer dang glog lta bu mthong ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: me 'bar ba dang / srin bu me khyer dang glog lta bu mthong ba rnams yin no //
translated: and seeing fire, fireflies, and lightning.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni mthong ngo cog mdog 'jam zhing skya ba dang / bstan par snang ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni mthong ngo cog mdog 'jam zhing skya ba dang / bstan par snang ba rnams yin no //

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of eye disease caused by a combination of humors are:

analyzed: mtshan ma de dag thams cad lta bur mthong ba yin no //

original: khrag las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni mthong ngo cog shin tu dmar bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i rab rib kyi mtshan ma ni mthong ngo cog shin tu dmar bar mthong ba yin no //

original: mig nad rab rib ces bya ba yal bar bor te /
analyzed: mig nad rab rib ces bya ba yal bar bor te /

analyzed: tshabs chen po las gyur pa la ni mig nad bris g-yogs pa zhes bya bar gyur te /
translated: The eye disease called “covering with a film” results from a serious disturbance.

analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na bad kan las gyur pa'i mig nad bris g-yogs pa ni gso sla ba yin te rtsa gtar zhing khrag dbyung na bzang ngo //
translated: Of these, the eye disease called “covering with a film” that results from phlegm is easy to cure. It is good to open the channels and let blood.

original: de la rab rib gso ba'i cho ga ni /
analyzed: de la rab rib gso ba'i cho ga ni /
translated: The ritual for curing cataracts is as follows.

original: aa ru ra'i tshi gu dang / shing mngar dang / skyu ru ra dang / na le sham dang / spangs ma rnams chu btags su byas pa'i ri lus bskus na mig nad rab rib rnams sel to //

translated: Make a pill from a myrobalan fruit, sweet flag, sour fruit, long pepper, and dried ginger, mixed with water. Rub it on the eyes and it will remove the eye disease of cataracts.

analyzed: yung dang / skyu ru ra dang / pi pi ling dang / ka ta ka'i 'bras bu dang / yungs kar rnams kyi phye ma char pa'i chu dang sbyar te /

analyzed: ri lur byas pas bskus @265b na yang mig nad do cog sel to //

translated: Make a paste of bhyahgri, ginger, mango fruit, sweet flag, long pepper, and rock salt in a copper vessel with goat’s milk and cow dung. If this is applied to the eyes,
