translated: When only a little sesame oil remains, strain it and insert it into the nose. This will eliminate the worms.

original: grang ba'i nad nyi ma shar nas nub kyi bar du na ba dang klad pa'i phyed na ba gnyis la ni /
analyzed: grang ba'i nad nyi ma shar nas nub kyi bar du na ba dang klad pa'i phyed na ba gnyis la ni /
translated: For a cold disease that occurs between sunrise and sunset, and for a headache on one side of the head,

original: thal tres dang / shing mngar dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma rtsabs skyur po dang sbyar te mgor byug go //
analyzed: thal tres dang / shing mngar dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma rtsabs skyur po dang sbyar te mgor byug go //
translated: one should apply a paste of white sugar, sweet flag, and valerian root mixed with sour gruel to the head.

original: yang na rlung dang mkhris pa la phan pa'i sman bskol ba'i khu bas mgor blug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rlung dang mkhris pa la phan pa'i sman bskol ba'i khu bas mgor blug par bya'o //
translated: Or, one should pour a decoction boiled with medicines beneficial for wind and bile into the head.

original: kha zas ni zhi ti'u la sogs pa rlung dang mkhris pa la phan pa'i kha zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha zas ni zhi ti'u la sogs pa rlung dang mkhris pa la phan pa'i kha zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: As for food, one should eat foods beneficial for wind and bile, such as shīta.

original: sna ma'i thal ba dang / gla sgang dang / shing tsha dang / ras bal gyi 'bras bu rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: sna ma'i thal ba dang / gla sgang dang / shing tsha dang / ras bal gyi 'bras bu rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
translated: A decoction boiled with the ashes of jasmine, ginger, śirīṣa, and cotton seeds,

original: yang na shing mngar gyi phye ma mar dang bskol la btsags te snar blugs na klad pa'i nad thams cad sel to //
analyzed: yang na shing mngar gyi phye ma mar dang bskol la btsags te snar blugs na klad pa'i nad thams cad sel to //
translated: or else a paste of madhuka boiled with ghee, strained, and poured into the nose, cures all diseases of the head.

original: yang na bca' sga dang / byi dong ka dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma /
analyzed: yang na bca' sga dang / byi dong ka dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma /
translated: Or else, a paste of bhṛṅgarāja, bhūnimba, and madhuka,

original: bhring ga r'a dza bskol ba'i khu ba dang / mar gyi nang du bskol ba las thigs pa drug snar blugs na nam tshong yan chad kyi nad thams cad sel to /
analyzed: bhring ga r'a dza bskol ba'i khu ba dang / mar gyi nang du bskol ba las thigs pa drug snar blugs na nam tshong yan chad kyi nad thams cad sel to /
translated: boiled in a decoction of bhṛṅgarāja and boiled in ghee, six drops of which are poured into the nose, cures all diseases up to nāḍī disorders.

original: // / da ni skra dkar po'i rtsi bshad de /
analyzed: // / da ni skra dkar po'i rtsi bshad de /
translated: Now, the treatment for gray hair is explained.

original: pra punda ri ka dang / shing mngar dang / pi pi ling dang / au tpal dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma skyu ru ra bskol ba'i khu ba dang til mar gyi nang du bskol la til nyi tshe lus pa snar blugs na /
analyzed: pra punda ri ka dang / shing mngar dang / pi pi ling dang / au tpal dang / tsan dan rnams kyi phye ma skyu ru ra bskol ba'i khu ba dang til mar gyi nang du bskol la til nyi tshe lus pa snar blugs na /
translated: Grind together prapunnagika, sweet wood, long pepper, utpala, and sandalwood, and mix with the juice of jujube boiled in sesame oil. If you put a little sesame oil in your nose,

original: skra dkar ba dang / skra ser ba med par byed do //
analyzed: skra dkar ba dang / skra ser ba med par byed do //
translated: it will eliminate gray hair and yellow hair.

original: yang na sman ram dang / she lu dang / til dang / ba ru ra rnams kyi mar bhri ngga r'a dza dang / ni li dang / ku ran dha dang / shri sha rnams kyi khu ba dang bskol te mar nyi tshe lus pa las rtag tu snar blugs na skra dkar med par gyur /
analyzed: yang na sman ram dang / she lu dang / til dang / ba ru ra rnams kyi mar bhri ngga r'a dza dang / ni li dang / ku ran dha dang / shri sha rnams kyi khu ba dang bskol te mar nyi tshe lus pa las rtag tu snar blugs na skra dkar med par gyur /
translated: Alternatively, boil sesame oil with the juice of ram, shelu, sesame, and sweet flag, and mix with the juice of bhringaraja, nutmeg, kurandha, and shrisha. If you always put a little sesame oil in your nose, it will eliminate gray hair.

original: rma bya'i mkhris pa dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang / shing la ko dang / ma ta @270b yan ti dang / stong zil dang / autpal dang / ni li dang / bhringga r'a dza dang / nag tshur rnams gyi phye ma ba ru ra'i mar dang chu'i nang du bskol te /
analyzed: rma bya'i mkhris pa dang / padma'i rtsa ba dang / shing la ko dang / ma ta @270b yan ti dang / stong zil dang / autpal dang / ni li dang / bhringga r'a dza dang / nag tshur rnams gyi phye ma ba ru ra'i mar dang chu'i nang du bskol te /
translated: The ashes of peacock bile, lotus root, lako, mata yanti, stong zil, utpala, nili, bhringaraja, and nag tshur are boiled in ghee and water.

original: ba ru ra'i mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags la zla ba gcig gi bar du lcags kyi snod du bzhag ste /
analyzed: ba ru ra'i mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags la zla ba gcig gi bar du lcags kyi snod du bzhag ste /
translated: The ghee is strained and left in an iron vessel for one month.

original: mgo la bsku zhing snar blugs na /
analyzed: mgo la bsku zhing snar blugs na /
translated: If it is applied to the head and put in the nose,

original: de ma thag tu dus la ma bab par skra dkar ba dang / dus la ba ba ste skra dkar ba med par byed do //
analyzed: de ma thag tu dus la ma bab par skra dkar ba dang / dus la ba ba ste skra dkar ba med par byed do //
translated: immediately, without dying, it will remove white hair and premature aging.

original: lcags kyi phye ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'bras rnams rtsabs skyur po dang / tshva dang / zho kha chu rnams gang yang rung ba'i nang du bskol bas nub mo mgo la byugs la /
analyzed: lcags kyi phye ma dang / rgyam tsha dang / 'bras rnams rtsabs skyur po dang / tshva dang / zho kha chu rnams gang yang rung ba'i nang du bskol bas nub mo mgo la byugs la /
translated: Iron filings, salt, and rice are boiled in any sour root, salt, or buttermilk. At night, apply it to the head.

original: nang par 'bras bu gsum bskol ba'i khu bas bkrus na skra nag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang par 'bras bu gsum bskol ba'i khu bas bkrus na skra nag por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the morning, wash it with a decoction of the three fruits. The hair will become black.

original: skra 'khor ling du byi ba la ni /
analyzed: skra 'khor ling du byi ba la ni /
translated: For gray hair,

original: sman sra ha ta'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman sra ha ta'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar te bskus na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: apply a paste of the juice of srahaḍa mixed with honey.

original: yang na 'ol ma se'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu gang yang rung ba ba gcin dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na 'ol ma se'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu gang yang rung ba ba gcin dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Or apply the root of the Indian toothache tree and any fruit mixed with cow’s urine,

original: yang na go bye'i khu bas byug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na go bye'i khu bas byug par bya'o //
translated: or apply the juice of gokṣura.

original: shing pa ta'i myu gu dang / bhringga r'a dza'i phye ma sle tres kyi khu ba dang sbyar te nyi tshan gyi drod kyis bsros pas bskus na yang skra mi skye ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing pa ta'i myu gu dang / bhringga r'a dza'i phye ma sle tres kyi khu ba dang sbyar te nyi tshan gyi drod kyis bsros pas bskus na yang skra mi skye ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or apply the juice of the sprouts of the pāṭa tree and the powder of bṛṃgarāja mixed with the juice of citron and warmed by the heat of the sun.

original: mig nad la phan par 'dod pas ni rtag tu mar btung ba dang / 'bras bu gsum gyi sman sbyar ba dang / gtar ga gdab pa dang / bkru sman btang zhing kha zas su 'bras dang / mon sran sde'u dang / nas dang / ri dags skam san gnas pa'i sha bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig nad la phan par 'dod pas ni rtag tu mar btung ba dang / 'bras bu gsum gyi sman sbyar ba dang / gtar ga gdab pa dang / bkru sman btang zhing kha zas su 'bras dang / mon sran sde'u dang / nas dang / ri dags skam san gnas pa'i sha bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to benefit eye disease should always drink ghee, apply medicine of the three fruits, perform bloodletting, administer purgatives, and eat rice, mung beans, barley, and the meat of dry-land deer.

original: mig sman gyi rgyud kyi le'u rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mig sman gyi rgyud kyi le'u rtsa drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sixth chapter of the Eye Medicine Tantra is complete.

original: // / sman dpyad gces pa grub pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: // / sman dpyad gces pa grub pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Essential Accomplishment of Medical Treatments, Chapter 7

original: bam po bdun pa ste tha ma'o /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa ste tha ma'o /
translated: The seventh and final chapter.

original: // / de nas dug gso ba'i rgyud kyi le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas dug gso ba'i rgyud kyi le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on treating poisons from the Tantra will be explained.

original: dug ni rtsi dug dang / sdig sbrul gyi za dug dang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: dug ni rtsi dug dang / sdig sbrul gyi za dug dang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Poisons are of two types: plant poisons and snakebite poisons.

original: de la rtsi dug ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de la rtsi dug ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: Among them, plant poisons are of the nature of roots and so forth.

original: phyi ma ni sbrul la sogs pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni sbrul la sogs pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: The latter arises from snakes and so forth.

original: dug la phan gnod rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: dug la phan gnod rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: Poisons have ten aspects of benefit and harm.

original: yang ba dang / ro mi bro ba dang / cha phras te rtsar 'gro ba dang / rtsub @271a * //
analyzed: yang ba dang / ro mi bro ba dang / cha phras te rtsar 'gro ba dang / rtsub @271a * //
translated: rough,🔽hot,🔽quick,🔽pervading,🔽combining smells,

original: pa dang / drod che ba dang / myur ba dang / khyab pa dang / bad kan sdud cing 'dren pa dang / dri sbyor ba dang / rno ba rnams yin par bshad do //
analyzed: pa dang / drod che ba dang / myur ba dang / khyab pa dang / bad kan sdud cing 'dren pa dang / dri sbyor ba dang / rno ba rnams yin par bshad do //
translated: and sharp.

original: sbrul ni mgo che ba'i rigs dang / lus 'khyil ba'i rigs dang / khra bo'i rigs 'di gsum gyi bye brag las /
analyzed: sbrul ni mgo che ba'i rigs dang / lus 'khyil ba'i rigs dang / khra bo'i rigs 'di gsum gyi bye brag las /
translated: There are three types of snakes: the large-headed type, the coiled body type, and the striped type.🔽They are explained as having three natures:

original: rlung gi rang bzhin can dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin can dang gsum yod par bshad de /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin can dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin can dang gsum yod par bshad de /
translated: wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: go rim bzhin du so sor sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rim bzhin du so sor sbyar ro //
translated: They should be applied individually in order.

original: rigs 'dres pa ni mtshan ma gnyis gnyis 'dres pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs 'dres pa ni mtshan ma gnyis gnyis 'dres pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The mixed type has two characteristics mixed together.

original: de la sbrul mgo chen po'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
analyzed: de la sbrul mgo chen po'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
translated: Among them, being bitten by the large-headed type of snake

original: rma kha gnag pa yin no //
analyzed: rma kha gnag pa yin no //
translated: causes the wound to turn black.

original: rlung nad kyi rnam grangs dang / mtshan ma thams cad bskyed do //
analyzed: rlung nad kyi rnam grangs dang / mtshan ma thams cad bskyed do //
translated: It produces all the symptoms and classifications of wind disorders.

original: sbrul lus 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
analyzed: sbrul lus 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
translated: If one is bitten by a coiled-body type of snake,

original: rma kha che la mdog ser zhing skrangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rma kha che la mdog ser zhing skrangs pa yin te /
translated: the wound is large, yellow, and swollen.

original: mkhris pa'i nad gyi sna grangs dang mtshan ma thams cad skyed do //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i nad gyi sna grangs dang mtshan ma thams cad skyed do //
translated: It produces all the symptoms and signs of a pitta disorder.

original: sbrul khra bo'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
analyzed: sbrul khra bo'i rigs kyis zin pa ni /
translated: If one is bitten by a multicolored snake,

original: rma dbal skya zhing /
analyzed: rma dbal skya zhing /
translated: the wound is pale,

original: skrangs pa myur du 'dzub tu mi btub la 'byil zhing snum pa dang / khrag 'dzag pa shin tu bska ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: skrangs pa myur du 'dzub tu mi btub la 'byil zhing snum pa dang / khrag 'dzag pa shin tu bska ba rnams yin te /
translated: swollen, and does not quickly become numb. It is smooth, oozes blood, and is very astringent.

original: bad kan gyi nad kyi sna grangs dang / mchan ma thams cad skyed do //
analyzed: bad kan gyi nad kyi sna grangs dang / mchan ma thams cad skyed do //
translated: It produces all the symptoms and signs of a kapha disorder.

original: rgyu skar mchu dang / lag dang / smin drug dang / skag dang / bra nye dang / gre dang / chu stod dang / khrums smad rnams kyi nyin par sbrul gyis zin pa ni shin tu bsgrims na 'ga' zhig 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu skar mchu dang / lag dang / smin drug dang / skag dang / bra nye dang / gre dang / chu stod dang / khrums smad rnams kyi nyin par sbrul gyis zin pa ni shin tu bsgrims na 'ga' zhig 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is bitten by a snake on the days of the lunar mansions Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Maghā, Mūla, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, or Śravaṇa, if one is very careful, some will die.

original: tshes bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / dgu dang / nyi shu dgu dang / dus tshigs gnyis te /
analyzed: tshes bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / dgu dang / nyi shu dgu dang / dus tshigs gnyis te /
translated: On the fourth, fifth, sixth, ninth, twenty-ninth, and on the two solstices,

original: nam langs ka dang / nam tshab tshub dang / 'di rnams kyi dus su sbrul gyis zin pa yang mi bzad pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: nam langs ka dang / nam tshab tshub dang / 'di rnams kyi dus su sbrul gyis zin pa yang mi bzad pa yin par bshad do //
translated: It is said that a snakebite at dawn, dusk, or midnight is also severe.

original: sbrul gyis zin pa las /
analyzed: sbrul gyis zin pa las /
translated: In the case of a snakebite,

original: skra 'byi ba dang / lus phrugs sam blud na /
analyzed: skra 'byi ba dang / lus phrugs sam blud na /
translated: if the hair is disheveled, the body is covered in goosebumps, or the person is unconscious,

original: rjes mi snang ba dang / shin tu grang mos kyang ba spu mi ldang zhing /
analyzed: rjes mi snang ba dang / shin tu grang mos kyang ba spu mi ldang zhing /
translated: if the person does not appear to be in pain, and if the body hair does not stand on end even in very cold weather,

original: grang 'brum mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni sbang bar bya'o //
analyzed: grang 'brum mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni sbang bar bya'o //
translated: and if there is no shivering, then the person should be considered dead.

original: de la thog ma zin ma thag tu snying la dug mi 'dzin par bsrung @271b ba'i phyir smyur te mar sbyin no //
analyzed: de la thog ma zin ma thag tu snying la dug mi 'dzin par bsrung @271b ba'i phyir smyur te mar sbyin no //
translated: In the beginning, immediately after the bite, ghee should be given quickly to protect the heart from the poison.

original: de nas gang zin pa bcing ba dang / brdabs ru la sogs pas gzhib cing drang ba dang / gar zin pa chu bkor  du bcas pa dang / rma kha bsreg pa dang / rma kha dang / nyen kor nas gtar zhing khrag dbyung ba rnams bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: de nas gang zin pa bcing ba dang / brdabs ru la sogs pas gzhib cing drang ba dang / gar zin pa chu bkor  du bcas pa dang / rma kha bsreg pa dang / rma kha dang / nyen kor nas gtar zhing khrag dbyung ba rnams bya bar bshad do //
translated: Then, the bitten area should be bound, massaged with a beating stick, and straightened out; the bitten area should be tied with a tourniquet; the wound should be cauterized; and blood should be drawn from the wound and its surroundings.

original: de la sbrul mgo chen po'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
analyzed: de la sbrul mgo chen po'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
translated: In the case of a bite by a large-headed snake,

original: nir rgun thi dang / shve ti'i khu ba 'thungs na sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nir rgun thi dang / shve ti'i khu ba 'thungs na sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Drink a decoction of nirguṇḍī and śvetā to cure it.

original: yang na srin bu bar dza'i rtsa ba'i phye ma rang gi khu ba dang brdzis te skams la slar yang brdzi zhing bskam pa de lta bur lan mang du bskol te btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na srin bu bar dza'i rtsa ba'i phye ma rang gi khu ba dang brdzis te skams la slar yang brdzi zhing bskam pa de lta bur lan mang du bskol te btung bar bya'o //
translated: Or, grind the root of the worm-plant with its own juice, dry it, grind it again, dry it, and so on, many times. Boil it and drink it.

original: sbrul lus 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
analyzed: sbrul lus 'khyil ba'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
translated: For a case of being bitten by a coiled-body type of snake,

original: shing ba ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang / btsod dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs tsi ba dang / kha ra dang / tam ba la dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba'am chu bskol te bsgrangs ba dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: shing ba ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang / btsod dang / dzi ba ka dang / zangs tsi ba dang / kha ra dang / tam ba la dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba'am chu bskol te bsgrangs ba dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: drink a powder of the tips of the branches of the pāṭalī tree, madder, jīvaka, copper-colored leadwort, sugar, tamāla, and sweet flag, mixed with the juice of washed rice or boiled water.

original: sbrul khro bo'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
analyzed: sbrul khro bo'i rigs kyis zin pa la ni /
translated: For a case of being bitten by an angry type of snake,

original: ha re nu ka dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / tsha ba gsum dang / pu tse shel dang / bong nga dkar po dang / shing mngar dang / khyim gyi dud pa rnams kyi phye mchu bskol ba grang mo dang sbyar te bzungs na dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ha re nu ka dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / tsha ba gsum dang / pu tse shel dang / bong nga dkar po dang / shing mngar dang / khyim gyi dud pa rnams kyi phye mchu bskol ba grang mo dang sbyar te bzungs na dug sel bar byed do //
translated: Harītakī, ruta, Indian valerian, the three hot medicines, purisela, white mussel shell, sweet flag, and household smoke are mixed with cold water and used as an eye lotion to remove poison.

original: spang spos dang / tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha dang / pi pi ling dang / shing mngar dang / na le sham dang / autpal dang / ba lang gi mkhris pa rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te btsags la mig bskus na dug gis phog ste brgyal ba slar langs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang spos dang / tsan dan dang / rgyam tsha dang / pi pi ling dang / shing mngar dang / na le sham dang / autpal dang / ba lang gi mkhris pa rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te btsags la mig bskus na dug gis phog ste brgyal ba slar langs par 'gyur ro //
translated: A decoction of spang spos, sandalwood, rock salt, long pepper, sweet flag, nutmeg, utpala, and cow bile is strained and used as an eye lotion to revive someone who has fainted from being poisoned.

original: yang na na kta ma la dang / po son cha dang / tsha ba gsum dang / bilpa'i rtsa ba dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / byi'u rug gi me tog dang / 'di rnams phye ma ra gcin dang sbyar te btsags pas mig bskus na yang slar dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na na kta ma la dang / po son cha dang / tsha ba gsum dang / bilpa'i rtsa ba dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / byi'u rug gi me tog dang / 'di rnams phye ma ra gcin dang sbyar te btsags pas mig bskus na yang slar dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, one should grind together nutmeg, posohna, the three hot spices, the root of bael, turmeric, ginger, and the flower of the Indian caper, and mix it with goat’s urine. If one smears the eyes with this, one will recover one’s memory.

original: ma yu ra ka'i sa bon dang / shi ri sha'i sa bon dang / rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma 'am /
analyzed: ma yu ra ka'i sa bon dang / shi ri sha'i sa bon dang / rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma 'am /
translated: Or else, one should grind together the seeds of the Indian licorice, the seeds of the Indian sesbania, and black salt.

original: yang na nas dang / po son cha'i sa bon dang / pa ta rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te btsags pa snar blugs na yang slar dran bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na nas dang / po son cha'i sa bon dang / pa ta rnams kyi phye ma chu dang sbyar te btsags pa snar blugs na yang slar dran bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, one should grind together barley, the seeds of the Indian sesbania, and patra, mix it with water, and insert it into the nose. In this way, one will recover one’s memory.

original: sman karko ta'i @272a * //
analyzed: sman karko ta'i @272a * //
translated: The root of the medicinal plant karkota

original: rtsa ba'i phye ma ra gcin gyis lan mang du bsgos la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i phye ma ra gcin gyis lan mang du bsgos la /
translated: should be ground and soaked many times in goat’s urine.

original: rtsa bas dang lhan cig tu btags te btsags pa snar blugs na yang dug gis sems nyams par byas pa las slar dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa bas dang lhan cig tu btags te btsags pa snar blugs na yang dug gis sems nyams par byas pa las slar dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should mix it with the root of the medicinal plant jivaka and insert it into the nose. In this way, one will recover one’s memory if one’s mind has been impaired by poison.

original: shi ri sha dang / aa rishta dang / nakta ma la dang / ba la dang / ko sha ta ka'i 'bras bu rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang lhan cig tu btags te btsags pa ni dug sman gyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: shi ri sha dang / aa rishta dang / nakta ma la dang / ba la dang / ko sha ta ka'i 'bras bu rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang lhan cig tu btags te btsags pa ni dug sman gyi mchog yin te /
translated: The best antidotes are the powders of śirīṣa, ariṣṭa, naktamāla, bala, and kośātaki fruit, mixed with cow’s urine and strained.

original: btung ba la sogs pa byas na dug sel bar byed do //🔽aa ko ta dang / aa rishta dang / dha du ra dang / snu hakshi ri dang / ka ranydza dang / aa sho ma ra dang / pu na rna ba dang / kru trug tres dang / pha li dang / sna ma'i me tog dang /🔽dug mo nyung gi shun lpags dang / aarka rnams sbyar ba yang dug sman chen po yin no //
analyzed: btung ba la sogs pa byas na dug sel bar byed do // aa ko ta dang / aa rishta dang / dha du ra dang / snu hakshi ri dang / ka ranydza dang / aa sho ma ra dang / pu na rna ba dang / kru trug tres dang / pha li dang / sna ma'i me tog dang / dug mo nyung gi shun lpags dang / aarka rnams sbyar ba yang dug sman chen po yin no //
translated: If one drinks them and so forth, they will remove poison.🔽A great antidote is a compound of aśoka, ariṣṭa, dhātakī, snuhīkṣīrī, karṇaja, aśomarī, punarnavā, kṛtavetas, phalinī, jasmine,🔽the outer skin of black aconite, and arka.

original: rgya spos dang / na le sham dang / ldong ros dang / thang shing dang / nakta ma la dang / aarka dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shi ri sha dang / pi pi ling rnams sbyar ba yang dug sman yin te /
analyzed: rgya spos dang / na le sham dang / ldong ros dang / thang shing dang / nakta ma la dang / aarka dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shi ri sha dang / pi pi ling rnams sbyar ba yang dug sman yin te /
translated: Another antidote is a compound of eaglewood, nut grass, red arsenic, pine resin, naktamāla, arka, turmeric, barberry, śirīṣa, and long pepper.

original: dug sel bar byed do //
analyzed: dug sel bar byed do //
translated: It removes poison.

original: sku ba ro kha ba'i sa bon ba lang gi mkhris pa dang lhan cig tu btags pa 'di ni tshangs pa'i dug sman zhes bya ste btung ba la sogs pa byas na dug thams cad sel to //
analyzed: sku ba ro kha ba'i sa bon ba lang gi mkhris pa dang lhan cig tu btags pa 'di ni tshangs pa'i dug sman zhes bya ste btung ba la sogs pa byas na dug thams cad sel to //
translated: This is called the poison medicine of Brahma. If one drinks it and so forth, it removes all poisons.

original: shi ri shi'i rtsa ba dang / shun lpags dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / sa bon rnam pa 'di lnga ba gcin dang lhan cig tu btags pa'i sman 'di yang dug sel ba yin no //
analyzed: shi ri shi'i rtsa ba dang / shun lpags dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / sa bon rnam pa 'di lnga ba gcin dang lhan cig tu btags pa'i sman 'di yang dug sel ba yin no //
translated: This medicine, which is a compound of the five parts of the shirisha tree — root, bark, leaf, flower, and seed — together with urine, also removes poison.

original: btsod dang / sug smel dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / rgya skyegs dang / spang spos dang / shing mngar dang / ha re nu ka rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'di yang dug sman yin te /
analyzed: btsod dang / sug smel dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / rgya skyegs dang / spang spos dang / shing mngar dang / ha re nu ka rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'di yang dug sman yin te /
translated: This is also a poison medicine: a compound of turmeric, dry ginger, indigo, bamboo manna, lac, costus, sweet flag, and harītakī, mixed with honey.

original: dug sel ba dang / brgyal ba las slar dran par byed pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: dug sel ba dang / brgyal ba las slar dran par byed pa la sogs pa'i las thams cad byed do //
translated: It performs all functions such as removing poison and reviving someone who has fainted.

original: lan tshva rnam pa lnga dang / shing nye rong dang / danti mu la dang / ba shi la dang / tsha ba gsum dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / btsod rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i dug @272b sman dva'i nang du bzhag pa yang las thams cad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lan tshva rnam pa lnga dang / shing nye rong dang / danti mu la dang / ba shi la dang / tsha ba gsum dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / btsod rnams kyi phye ma sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i dug @272b sman dva'i nang du bzhag pa yang las thams cad byed pa yin no //
translated: nyerong, dantimula, bashila, the three hot spices, turmeric, kyera, and red buckthorn ground together with honey and placed in a poison-neutralizing vessel will also perform all activities.

original: tsan dan dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / ru rta dang / shing tsha dang / gandha pa tra dang / sug smel dang / gla sgang dang / yungs kar dang / spang spos dang / shug pa dang / rgya spos dang /
analyzed: tsan dan dang / ba bla dang / ldong ros dang / ru rta dang / shing tsha dang / gandha pa tra dang / sug smel dang / gla sgang dang / yungs kar dang / spang spos dang / shug pa dang / rgya spos dang /
translated: Sandalwood, babula, red arsenic, frankincense, pine resin, gandhapatra, nutmeg, ginger, white mustard seed, spang spos, juniper, devadaru,

original: gur gum dang / bye'u rug pa dang / ae ka h'a dang / smyig rkang dang / spri ka dang / shing kun dang / ba la ka dang / la matstsha dang / shu ti dang / gandha pri yam ku rnams kyi phye ma sbyar ba'i dug sman gyi ming ni /
analyzed: gur gum dang / bye'u rug pa dang / ae ka h'a dang / smyig rkang dang / spri ka dang / shing kun dang / ba la ka dang / la matstsha dang / shu ti dang / gandha pri yam ku rnams kyi phye ma sbyar ba'i dug sman gyi ming ni /
translated: saffron, ruka, ekaha, bamboo, prikka, devadaru, balaka, lamtsha, shuti, and gandhapriyangu ground together and mixed with poison will neutralize it.

original: zla shar zhes bya ste dug thams cad 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: zla shar zhes bya ste dug thams cad 'joms par byed do //
translated: The name of this poison-destroying medicine is “Moon-rise.”

original: shing nye rong dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / pa ta li dang / pi pi ling dang / btsod dang / ki ni hi dang / ldong ros dang / go byi ta ra dang / na le sham dang / rgya spos dang / yung dang /
analyzed: shing nye rong dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / pa ta li dang / pi pi ling dang / btsod dang / ki ni hi dang / ldong ros dang / go byi ta ra dang / na le sham dang / rgya spos dang / yung dang /
translated: The powders of nyagrodha, nāgakesara, paṭalī, pippalī, turmeric, kīṇahī, realgar, gojihva, śleṣmātaka, devakāṣṭha, and indigo;

original: skyer pa dang / pog dkar po dang / aa pa ra dzi ta dang / bri ha t'i dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang lhan cig btags pa'i dug sman 'di'i ming ni /
analyzed: skyer pa dang / pog dkar po dang / aa pa ra dzi ta dang / bri ha t'i dang / shing mngar rnams kyi phye ma ba gcin dang lhan cig btags pa'i dug sman 'di'i ming ni /
translated: and the powders of kīra, white poon, aparājita, bṛhatī, and sweet wood, mixed with cow’s urine, are the poison-destroying medicine called

original: nyi shar zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyi shar zhes bya ste /
translated: “Sun-rise.”

original: dug dang gdon thub po //
analyzed: dug dang gdon thub po //
translated: It is able to overcome poisons and spirits.

original: ai shva ra dang / chu shing dang / na gi dang / tsan dra dang / shve ta dang / mon sne'u dmar ru dang / nirgunti rnams sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: ai shva ra dang / chu shing dang / na gi dang / tsan dra dang / shve ta dang / mon sne'u dmar ru dang / nirgunti rnams sbyar ba'am /
translated: A combination of iṣvāra, plantain, nāgī, candra, śveta, red mon, and nirguṇḍī,

original: yang na re re yang rung ste dug gsod pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: yang na re re yang rung ste dug gsod pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: or each of them individually, is the best for destroying poisons.

original: rgya skyegs shing gi thal ba pa chu dang sbyar te btsags la dri ma dang snyigs ma bor ba'i nang du /
analyzed: rgya skyegs shing gi thal ba pa chu dang sbyar te btsags la dri ma dang snyigs ma bor ba'i nang du /
translated: Mix the ash of lac wood with water, strain it, and discard the impurities and dregs.

original: ha re nu ka dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / tsha ba gsum dang / bye'u rug pa dang / thal tres dang / gla sgang dang / spang spos dang / shing kun dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shing mngar dang /
analyzed: ha re nu ka dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / tsha ba gsum dang / bye'u rug pa dang / thal tres dang / gla sgang dang / spang spos dang / shing kun dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / shing mngar dang /
translated: Add to it the powders of harītakī, ruta, jātī, the three hot medicines, bhūrikā, turya, ginger, spang spos, devadāru, turmeric, kyera, sweet wood,

original: byi dang ga dang rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma bskol te gzar bu la chags su btub pa tsam du tshos nas /
analyzed: byi dang ga dang rgyam tsha rnams kyi phye ma bskol te gzar bu la chags su btub pa tsam du tshos nas /
translated: biji, and gya tsha, boil them, and cook them until they can be held in the palm of the hand.

original: rva'i nang du bzhag pa las nang re bzhin rgya shug gi 'brum bu tsam re re 'bras ba krus pa'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: rva'i nang du bzhag pa las nang re bzhin rgya shug gi 'brum bu tsam re re 'bras ba krus pa'i khu ba'am /
translated: Place them in a container and take one jujube fruit-sized pill each day.🔽Drink it with the juice of cooked barley, milk, or rainwater, whichever is appropriate.

original: 'o ma'am char pa'i chu gang yang rung ba dang sbyar te 'thungs na dug gi mthu chen po yang sel cing /
analyzed: 'o ma'am char pa'i chu gang yang rung ba dang sbyar te 'thungs na dug gi mthu chen po yang sel cing /
translated: It will remove even the power of great poisons.

original: gcong dang / skren dang / dmu rdzings dang / gzhang @273a * //
analyzed: gcong dang / skren dang / dmu rdzings dang / gzhang @273a * //
translated: It cures tumors, goiters, dropsy, hemorrhoids,

original: 'brum dang / gcin snyi ba'i nad dang / drod chung ba dang / rims rnams med par byed do //
analyzed: 'brum dang / gcin snyi ba'i nad dang / drod chung ba dang / rims rnams med par byed do //
translated: It cures smallpox, diabetes, poor digestion, and fevers.

original: yang na dug 'thungs pa la /
analyzed: yang na dug 'thungs pa la /
translated: Alternatively, if someone has drunk poison,

original: ba lang gi gci ba'i khu ba sprang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i skyug sman blud de skyug tu gzhug go /
analyzed: ba lang gi gci ba'i khu ba sprang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i skyug sman blud de skyug tu gzhug go /
translated: make them vomit by giving them a potion of cow’s urine mixed with honey.

original: dug sman gyi sbyor ba mang po rnams las gang gtang yang rung ste /
analyzed: dug sman gyi sbyor ba mang po rnams las gang gtang yang rung ste /
translated: Any of the many antidotes to poison may be used.

original: thog mar snying la dug mi 'dzin par bsrung ba'i phyir smyur te mar blud par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar snying la dug mi 'dzin par bsrung ba'i phyir smyur te mar blud par bya'o //
translated: But first, in order to protect the heart from the poison, give butter to eat immediately.

original: rtsa ba'i dug dang / mda' dug can gyis rmas pa la ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i dug dang / mda' dug can gyis rmas pa la ni /
translated: For root poisons and poisoned arrows,

original: yung dang / rgyam tshva dang / sbrang rtsi rnams sbyar ba'i mar mchog tu bzang ste btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yung dang / rgyam tshva dang / sbrang rtsi rnams sbyar ba'i mar mchog tu bzang ste btung bar bya'o //
translated: a mixture of indigo, black salt, and honey is an excellent butter that should be drunk.

original: zangs dang / gser gyi phye ma khar dang sbrang rtsis sbyar ba'i lde gu zos na dug sbyar ma shin tu drag po thams cad kyang zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: zangs dang / gser gyi phye ma khar dang sbrang rtsis sbyar ba'i lde gu zos na dug sbyar ma shin tu drag po thams cad kyang zhi bar byed do //
translated: A paste made from copper and gold dust mixed with sugar and honey, if eaten, will also cure all the most severe cases of poisoning.

original: sdig pas zin pa la ni shing t'a la'i lo ma dang / nimpa'i lo ma dang / skra dang / ras rnying pa rnams mar dang sbyar te bsregs pa'i dud pa'am /
analyzed: sdig pas zin pa la ni shing t'a la'i lo ma dang / nimpa'i lo ma dang / skra dang / ras rnying pa rnams mar dang sbyar te bsregs pa'i dud pa'am /
translated: For one seized by sin, fumigate with smoke of the leaves of the tāla tree, neem leaves, hair, and old cloth mixed with ghee,

original: yang na rma bya'i sgro 'o ma dang sbyar te bsregs pa'i dud pas bdugs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rma bya'i sgro 'o ma dang sbyar te bsregs pa'i dud pas bdugs par bya'o //
translated: or else with the smoke of a peacock’s feathers mixed with milk.

original: yang na pa la sha'i sa bon shing aarka'i 'o ma dang lhan gcig btags pa'i lde khu dang / yang na pi pi ling dang shi ri sha'i 'bras bu sbyar ba'i lde gus rma khar skus na sdig pa'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
analyzed: yang na pa la sha'i sa bon shing aarka'i 'o ma dang lhan gcig btags pa'i lde khu dang / yang na pi pi ling dang shi ri sha'i 'bras bu sbyar ba'i lde gus rma khar skus na sdig pa'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
translated: Or else, apply an ointment of the juice of palasha seeds mixed with arka plant milk, or else an ointment of pippali and śirīṣa fruit to the wound. This will remove the distress of poison from sin.

original: yang na ldong ros dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing kun dang / sna ma'i lo ma dang / bca' sga rnams kyi phye ma ba lang gi lci ba'i khu ba dang sbyar te btang la ri lu byas pa yang sdig pa'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
analyzed: yang na ldong ros dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing kun dang / sna ma'i lo ma dang / bca' sga rnams kyi phye ma ba lang gi lci ba'i khu ba dang sbyar te btang la ri lu byas pa yang sdig pa'i dug gis nyam thag pa sel to //
translated: Or else, give a compound of the powders of red arsenic, black salt, devadāru, jasmine, and betel nut mixed with the juice of cow dung, and make a pill. This will remove the distress of poison from sin.

original: byi ba'i sos zin pa'i dug la ni /
analyzed: byi ba'i sos zin pa'i dug la ni /
translated: For poison from a bite by a mouse,

original: til gyi rtsa ba dang / karko ta'i rtsa ba dang / ti la ka'i rtsa ba dang / gi ka rni ka'i rtsa ba rnams gyi phye ma khar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / sbyar te 'thung na byi bas zin pa'i dug sel to //
analyzed: til gyi rtsa ba dang / karko ta'i rtsa ba dang / ti la ka'i rtsa ba dang / gi ka rni ka'i rtsa ba rnams gyi phye ma khar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar dang / sbyar te 'thung na byi bas zin pa'i dug sel to //
translated: The powder of sesamum roots, the powder of karkoṭa roots, the powder of tilvaka roots, and the powder of gīkarṇikā roots, mixed with sugar, honey, and ghee, if drunk, will remove the poison of a rat bite.

original: yang na byi bas zin pa'i dug la /
analyzed: yang na byi bas zin pa'i dug la /
translated: Or, for the poison of a rat bite,

original: ha tsa ra'i rtsa ba'i phye ma dang / sbrang rtsi 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: ha tsa ra'i rtsa ba'i phye ma dang / sbrang rtsi 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: the powder of hacarī roots, mixed with honey and the juice of washed rice,

original: yang na ti la ka'i me tog gam lo ma gang yang rung ba 'o ma dang / lhan cig tu btags te btung bar @273b bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ti la ka'i me tog gam lo ma gang yang rung ba 'o ma dang / lhan cig tu btags te btung bar @273b bya'o //
translated: or else, the flower or leaf of tilvaka, whichever is suitable, should be taken together with milk.

original: yang na byi la'i sha'am /
analyzed: yang na byi la'i sha'am /
translated: Or, the soup of cooked cat meat,

original: ne'u le'i sha gang yang rung ba btsos pa'i khu ba 'thungs na /
analyzed: ne'u le'i sha gang yang rung ba btsos pa'i khu ba 'thungs na /
translated: or the soup of cooked mongoose meat, whichever is suitable, if drunk,

original: byi bas zin pa'i dug bla gnyan gyi nad dang bcas pa yang myur du sel to //
analyzed: byi bas zin pa'i dug bla gnyan gyi nad dang bcas pa yang myur du sel to //
translated: will quickly remove the poison of a rat bite, along with the disease of the powerful poison.

original: khyi smyon gyis zos pa la ni /
analyzed: khyi smyon gyis zos pa la ni /
translated: For one bitten by a mad dog,

original: shing aa ko ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang rtsa ba bskol te gdus pa'i khu ba srang gsum gyi nang du zhun mar srang gcig btab ste 'thungs na khyi smyon gyis zin pa'i dug sel to //
analyzed: shing aa ko ta'i yal ga'i thor to dang rtsa ba bskol te gdus pa'i khu ba srang gsum gyi nang du zhun mar srang gcig btab ste 'thungs na khyi smyon gyis zin pa'i dug sel to //
translated: Take three su of the decoction boiled from the top and root of the akot tree, add one su of ghee, and drink it. This will cure the poison of a rabid dog.

original: yang na bu mar dang / til btags pa'i phye ma shing aarka'i 'o ma dang til mar gyis sbyar te 'thungs na khyi so gdug pas zin pa'i dug 'tsho dka' ba yang myur du sel bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na bu mar dang / til btags pa'i phye ma shing aarka'i 'o ma dang til mar gyis sbyar te 'thungs na khyi so gdug pas zin pa'i dug 'tsho dka' ba yang myur du sel bar byed do //
translated: Alternatively, take a mixture of sesame oil, sesame flour, arka tree milk, and sesame oil. This will quickly cure even the difficult-to-cure poison of a rabid dog.

original: srog chags phra mo'o cog gis zin pa'i dug sman ni /
analyzed: srog chags phra mo'o cog gis zin pa'i dug sman ni /
translated: The medicine for the poison of any of the small creatures is as follows:

original: nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / svartsi ka'i thal ba dang / tsha ba gsum dang / shu dag dang / shing kun dang / byi dang ka dang / rgyam tsha dang / rgya spos dang / aam barta dang / bong nga dkar po dang /
analyzed: nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / svartsi ka'i thal ba dang / tsha ba gsum dang / shu dag dang / shing kun dang / byi dang ka dang / rgyam tsha dang / rgya spos dang / aam barta dang / bong nga dkar po dang /
translated: Take a mixture of the ashes of burnt barley, the ashes of burnt svarjika, the three hot medicines, shudag, shingkun, bhyidang, gyam tsha, gya phem, ambarata, and white bitumen.

original: ru rta rnams kyi phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i khu par btab cing bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: ru rta rnams kyi phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i khu par btab cing bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Make a paste with the flour of these ingredients and the water in which rice has been washed, and apply it as a compress.

original: shing nye rong gi rtsa ba dang / mon sne'u dmar ru'i phye ma cha bsnyams te /
analyzed: shing nye rong gi rtsa ba dang / mon sne'u dmar ru'i phye ma cha bsnyams te /
translated: The root of nyero and the powder of mon neumaru should be mixed in equal parts.

original: mar dang sbyar ba 'thungs na yang srog chags phra mo thams cad kyi dug shin tu mthu che ba yang myur du sel lo //🔽yang phug ron gyi rtug pa dang / dan ti mu la dang / ba lang gi so dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing nye rong dang / le brgan rtsi'i sa bon dang / slu ha shi ri dang / kru trug tres dang / karni kar rnams sbyar ba yang srog chags phra mo'i dug sel ba'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: mar dang sbyar ba 'thungs na yang srog chags phra mo thams cad kyi dug shin tu mthu che ba yang myur du sel lo // yang phug ron gyi rtug pa dang / dan ti mu la dang / ba lang gi so dang / rgyam tsha dang / shing nye rong dang / le brgan rtsi'i sa bon dang / slu ha shi ri dang / kru trug tres dang / karni kar rnams sbyar ba yang srog chags phra mo'i dug sel ba'i mchog yin no //
translated: If one drinks it mixed with ghee, it will quickly remove the very powerful poison of all small creatures.🔽Furthermore, the feces of a pigeon, dantimula, cow's tooth, gyam tsha, nyero, madder seed, luhashiri, kru truktre, and karnikara are also the best for removing the poison of small creatures.

original: tsan dan dang / shug pa dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / pu shel tse dang / pa tal dang / nirgun thi dang / thal tres dang / she lu rnams sbyar ba ni srog chags phra mos kha dug go cog gi dug sel ba'i sman yin no //
analyzed: tsan dan dang / shug pa dang / ru rta dang / rgya spos dang / pu shel tse dang / pa tal dang / nirgun thi dang / thal tres dang / she lu rnams sbyar ba ni srog chags phra mos kha dug go cog gi dug sel ba'i sman yin no //
translated: A combination of sandalwood, juniper, ruta, eaglewood, pushpel tse, patala, nirgunthi, taltre, and shelu is the medicine for removing the poison of all the mouth poisons of small creatures.

original: ka pittha dang / pa ta li dang / she lu dang / shi ri sha dang / pu na rna ba rnam gnyis dang / shve ta rnam gnyis dang / 'di rnams sbyar ba yang srog chags phra mos kha dug go cog gi dug thams cad @274a * //🔽sel ba'i sman yin no //

analyzed: // / de nas byis pa'i rgyud kyi le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the tantra of the child will be explained.

original: de la bud med ni dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la bud med ni dga' bar bya ste /

original: gnas dam pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas dam pa yin la /

original: bu rin thang med pa bskyed ba yin pas /
analyzed: bu rin thang med pa bskyed ba yin pas /

original: de'i mo mtshan la nad byung na dga' ba dang bu 'byung ba gnyig med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mo mtshan la nad byung na dga' ba dang bu 'byung ba gnyig med par 'gyur te /
translated: If a disease occurs in her vagina, both pleasure and the birth of a child will be absent.

original: de bas na de gso ba'i cho ga bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de gso ba'i cho ga bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the ritual for curing that should be explained.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad kyi mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad kyi mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of a disease of the vagina arising from wind are:

original: mo mtshan nab dang / mdog rtsub pa dang / yon por 'gyur ba dang / mkhrang pa dang / phal phal byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mo mtshan nab dang / mdog rtsub pa dang / yon por 'gyur ba dang / mkhrang pa dang / phal phal byed pa rnams yin no //
translated: the vagina is swollen, the color is rough, it is crooked, hard, and it throbs.

original: mkhris pa 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: mkhris pa 'khrugs pa'i mtshan ma las gyur pa ni /
translated: The signs of a disease of the vagina arising from bile being disturbed are:

original: mo mtshan tsha ba 'ur 'ur por byed pa dang / khrag 'dzag pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa rnams las rtogs bar bya'o //🔽bad kan 'khrugs pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan g-yeng ba dang / grang ba dang / bem bem por 'dug pa dang / 'bras khu 'dra bar dkar zhing /
analyzed: mo mtshan tsha ba 'ur 'ur por byed pa dang / khrag 'dzag pa dang / rims kyis 'debs pa rnams las rtogs bar bya'o // bad kan 'khrugs pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan g-yeng ba dang / grang ba dang / bem bem por 'dug pa dang / 'bras khu 'dra bar dkar zhing /
translated: the vagina is hot and makes a hissing sound, blood flows, and it is infected with fever.🔽The signs of a disease of the vagina arising from phlegm being disturbed are:

original: sbyin po 'byar 'byar po 'dzag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: sbyin po 'byar 'byar po 'dzag pa rnams yin no //
translated: the vagina is loose, cold, and numb, and it is white like rice gruel,

original: de la rlung @276a * //
analyzed: de la rlung @276a * //
translated: and a thick discharge oozes out.🔽The signs of a disease of the vagina arising from a combination of the three humors are:🔽all the above symptoms are mixed together.

original: las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad gso ba'i cho ga ni /🔽'bras kyi 'o thug gi dugs sam /
analyzed: las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad gso ba'i cho ga ni / 'bras kyi 'o thug gi dugs sam /
translated: The ritual for curing a vaginal disease caused by karma is as follows:🔽A compress of rice gruel,

original: mon sran sde'u'i chan gyi dugs sam /
analyzed: mon sran sde'u'i chan gyi dugs sam /
translated: or a compress of lentils,

original: yang na ras ma 'jam po til mar dron po'i nang du smyugs pa'i nang du btso zheng dugs bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ras ma 'jam po til mar dron po'i nang du smyugs pa'i nang du btso zheng dugs bya'o //
translated: or else a compress of soft cloth soaked in warm sesame oil.

original: mdor na rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
analyzed: mdor na rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
translated: In short, for a vaginal disease caused by wind,

original: sman mar btung ba dang / dugs bya ba dang / sman mas btang ba rnams bzang ngo //
analyzed: sman mar btung ba dang / dugs bya ba dang / sman mas btang ba rnams bzang ngo //
translated: drinking medicinal butter, compresses, and medicinal suppositories are good.

original: yang na mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /🔽pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / zin thig le'i rtsa ba'i phye ma chang dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na mo mtshan gyi nad la ni / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / zin thig le'i rtsa ba'i phye ma chang dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Or, for a vaginal disease,🔽a powder of long pepper root and the root of the navel-like plant mixed with beer,

original: yang na pi pi ling dang / au ba kun rtsi ka'i sa bon dang / kha ru chva rnams kyi phye ma chang dang sbyar te blud do //
analyzed: yang na pi pi ling dang / au ba kun rtsi ka'i sa bon dang / kha ru chva rnams kyi phye ma chang dang sbyar te blud do //
translated: or else a powder of long pepper, the seeds of the upakunchika plant, and kharuchha mixed with beer.

original: pha bong gi dreg pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / bha rgi dang / ra sna dang / sle tres dang / nye'u shing dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / pu na rna ba dang / me da dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma zho gnyis gnyis /
analyzed: pha bong gi dreg pa dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / bha rgi dang / ra sna dang / sle tres dang / nye'u shing dang / yung dang / skyer pa dang / pu na rna ba dang / me da dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma zho gnyis gnyis /
translated: The powders of limestone, the three fruits, bharangi, rasna, long pepper, neem, indigo, kasheruka, punarnava, and meda, each two palas.

original: mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'o ma mar gyi tshad kyi nang du bskol te mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa la ran par 'thungs na yang rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad sel zhing /
analyzed: mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'o ma mar gyi tshad kyi nang du bskol te mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa la ran par 'thungs na yang rlung las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad sel zhing /
translated: Thirty-two pala of ghee and milk equal to the ghee are boiled together. When the ghee is almost gone, it is strained and drunk in the right amount. This also cures vaginal diseases caused by wind.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nang la yang bzang la /
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nang la yang bzang la /
translated: It is also good for vaginal diseases caused by bile.

original: bu chags par byed pa'i mchog kyang yin no //
analyzed: bu chags par byed pa'i mchog kyang yin no //
translated: It is the best for conceiving a child.

original: mkhris pa 'khrugs pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
analyzed: mkhris pa 'khrugs pa las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
translated: For vaginal diseases caused by disturbed bile,

original: khrag lud pa'i nad bsal ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: khrag lud pa'i nad bsal ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: the procedure for treating blood expectoration should be done as explained before.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i mo mtshan gyi nad la ni /
translated: For vaginal diseases caused by phlegm,

original: dong ga la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi btung ba dang / bkru ba dang / steng du blug pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: dong ga la sogs pa'i sde tshan gyi btung ba dang / bkru ba dang / steng du blug pa dang / byug pa la sogs pa thams cad bya'o //
translated: One should do all the things such as drinking the decoctions of the groups of dongka and so forth, bathing, pouring on the head, and anointing.

original: de ltar mo mtshan gyi nyes pa dang / nad med par byas nas bu chags par bya ba'i thabs ni /
analyzed: de ltar mo mtshan gyi nyes pa dang / nad med par byas nas bu chags par bya ba'i thabs ni /
translated: Having thus removed the faults of the womb and made her healthy, the method of causing conception is as follows.

original: skyes pa snga nas sman dang kha zas bzang pos lus brta zhing nyal po mi bya bar 'dug la /
analyzed: skyes pa snga nas sman dang kha zas bzang pos lus brta zhing nyal po mi bya bar 'dug la /
translated: The man should beforehand strengthen his body with medicine and good food and abstain from sexual intercourse.

original: bud med zla mtshan byung nas zhag bzhi lon pa'i 'og tu khrus byas nas nyal na bu 'chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud med zla mtshan byung nas zhag bzhi lon pa'i 'og tu khrus byas nas nyal na bu 'chags par 'gyur te /
translated: If the woman, after her menstrual period, bathes and sleeps with him four days after the period, a son will be conceived.

original: de la zla mtshan byung nas zhag bzhi lon pa dang / zhag drug dang / brgyad dang / bcu dang / bcu gnyis lon pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la zla mtshan byung nas zhag bzhi lon pa dang / zhag drug dang / brgyad dang / bcu dang / bcu gnyis lon pa'i tshe /
translated: If she sleeps with him six, eight, ten, or twelve days after the period,

original: @276b nyal na bu khye'ur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @276b nyal na bu khye'ur 'gyur ro //
translated: a son will be born.

original: zla mtshan byung nas zhag lnga dang / bdun dang / dgu dang / bcu gcig lon pa'i cho nyal na bu mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla mtshan byung nas zhag lnga dang / bdun dang / dgu dang / bcu gcig lon pa'i cho nyal na bu mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If she sleeps with him five, seven, nine, or eleven days after the period, a daughter will be born.

original: de la skyes pa'i khu ba mang la bud med kyi khrag nyung na ni khye'ur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skyes pa'i khu ba mang la bud med kyi khrag nyung na ni khye'ur 'gyur ro //
translated: If the man’s semen is abundant and the woman’s blood is scant, then a boy will be born.

original: skyes pa'i khu ba nyung la bud med kyi khrag mang na ni bu mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i khu ba nyung la bud med kyi khrag mang na ni bu mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If the man’s semen is scant and the woman’s blood is abundant, then a girl will be born.

original: zla mtshan byung nas zhag bcu lon gsum lon phan chad ni bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla mtshan byung nas zhag bcu lon gsum lon phan chad ni bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: After ten or three days have passed since the onset of menstruation, a child will not be born.

original: de la khye'ur 'gyur bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de la khye'ur 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes for a boy to be born,

original: rgyam tsha 'am shing pa ta'i yal ga'am rtse mo gang yang rung ba'i phye ma 'o ma dang btags te btsags pa'i khu ba las thigs pa bzhi ma nyal ba'i snga rol tu bud med kyi sna g-yon par blugs na khye'ur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyam tsha 'am shing pa ta'i yal ga'am rtse mo gang yang rung ba'i phye ma 'o ma dang btags te btsags pa'i khu ba las thigs pa bzhi ma nyal ba'i snga rol tu bud med kyi sna g-yon par blugs na khye'ur 'gyur ro //
translated: one should mix the powder of either Gyam tsha or the branches or tips of a pāṭala tree with milk, strain the liquid, and inhale four drops of it through the left nostril of the woman before she goes to sleep. A boy will be born.

original: bud med zla mtshan dang ldan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bud med zla mtshan dang ldan pa'i tshe /
translated: When a woman is menstruating,

original: kha lung gi sa bon nam /
analyzed: kha lung gi sa bon nam /
translated: she should eat the seeds of a kha lung plant

original: n'a ga ge sar gang yang rung ba'i phye ma mar khu dang sbyar te bud med kyis 'thungs la skyes pa dang nyal na yang bu chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: n'a ga ge sar gang yang rung ba'i phye ma mar khu dang sbyar te bud med kyis 'thungs la skyes pa dang nyal na yang bu chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: or the powder of a nāga flower mixed with ghee. If she has intercourse with a man, a child will be conceived.

original: de la bu 'chags pa'i mtshan ma ni nu ma'i thor to mdog sdo skya bar 'dug na bu yod par shes par gyis shig / de ltar sbrum mar gyur nas las drag shul can dang / mya ngan dang / 'tsher ba dang / khro ba'i bag bsrung zhing gang yid la 'dod pa dang 'phrod pa rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bu 'chags pa'i mtshan ma ni nu ma'i thor to mdog sdo skya bar 'dug na bu yod par shes par gyis shig / de ltar sbrum mar gyur nas las drag shul can dang / mya ngan dang / 'tsher ba dang / khro ba'i bag bsrung zhing gang yid la 'dod pa dang 'phrod pa rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: When she is pregnant, she should be protected from violent actions, grief, heat, and anger, and should be given whatever she desires and finds agreeable.

original: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / brdegs shing snad pa dang kha zas dang skom po tsha ba dang drod ches pa zos shing 'thungs na ni bu 'byil bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang / brdegs shing snad pa dang kha zas dang skom po tsha ba dang drod ches pa zos shing 'thungs na ni bu 'byil bar 'gyur te /
translated: If she is frightened, terrified, beaten, injured, or eats or drinks very hot food or drink, the fetus will be aborted.

original: de yang khrag 'dzag cing na ba'i mtshan mas shes par byas la slar gso ba'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: de yang khrag 'dzag cing na ba'i mtshan mas shes par byas la slar gso ba'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: This should be understood by the signs of bleeding and pain, and the ritual for healing should be performed again.

original: de lta bu gso ba la ni /
analyzed: de lta bu gso ba la ni /
translated: For healing such a condition,

original: sman gyi khu ba grang mo lus la blugs pa dang sman gyi khu ba grang mo'i nang du 'jug pa dang sman bsil ba'i bag gis lus byugs pa rnams bzang ngo //
analyzed: sman gyi khu ba grang mo lus la blugs pa dang sman gyi khu ba grang mo'i nang du 'jug pa dang sman bsil ba'i bag gis lus byugs pa rnams bzang ngo //
translated: it is good to pour cold medicinal liquids on the body, to insert cold medicinal liquids, and to anoint the body with a paste of cooling medicines.

original: gzhan yang bu 'byil du byed pa slar gso ba'i sman ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang bu 'byil du byed pa slar gso ba'i sman ni /
translated: Furthermore, the medicine for restoring the fetus is as follows:

original: sman 'tsho byed sna bcu 'o ma dang bskol te btsags la kha ra dang sbyar te blud do //🔽yang tsan dan dkar po dang / bu tshang rto dang / rgun dang / bu shel tse dang / kha ra rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu sbyar ba dang / shing mngar dang / rgya shug gi 'bras bu dang / sug @277a * //
analyzed: sman 'tsho byed sna bcu 'o ma dang bskol te btsags la kha ra dang sbyar te blud do // yang tsan dan dkar po dang / bu tshang rto dang / rgun dang / bu shel tse dang / kha ra rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu sbyar ba dang / shing mngar dang / rgya shug gi 'bras bu dang / sug @277a * //
translated: Cook the ten roots with milk, strain it, and mix with sugar.🔽Also, mix together the powders of white sandalwood, burt sa, grapes, and sugar.🔽Mix together the powders of sweet flag, jujube fruit, dry ginger, turmeric, and dhataki flowers with sugar.

original: smel dang / btsod dang / dha ta ka'i me tog dang kha ra rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig sbyar ba dang / kha ra dang / autpal dang / shing mngar dang / seng phrom dang / tsan dan dkar po dang / thal tres rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu sbyar ba dang /
analyzed: smel dang / btsod dang / dha ta ka'i me tog dang kha ra rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig sbyar ba dang / kha ra dang / autpal dang / shing mngar dang / seng phrom dang / tsan dan dkar po dang / thal tres rnams kyi phye ma lhan cig tu sbyar ba dang /
translated: Mix together the powders of sugar, blue lotus, sweet flag, pomegranate, white sandalwood, and taltris.

original: sman gyi sbyor ba 'di gsum las gang yang rung ba 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba dang sbyar te blud do //
analyzed: sman gyi sbyor ba 'di gsum las gang yang rung ba 'bras bkrus pa'i khu ba dang sbyar te blud do //
translated: Give any of these three medicinal preparations mixed with the liquid of washed rice.

original: yang na sman gyi sde tshan sngar bshad pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: yang na sman gyi sde tshan sngar bshad pa'i nang nas /
translated: Alternatively, from among the medicinal classes explained above,

original: autpal la sogs pa'i sde tshan smos pa rnams btags la /
analyzed: autpal la sogs pa'i sde tshan smos pa rnams btags la /
translated: the classes beginning with utpala are indicated.

original: kha ra dang 'o mar sbyar te blud do //
analyzed: kha ra dang 'o mar sbyar te blud do //
translated: Mix with sugar and milk and administer.

original: yang na n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i sde tshan rnams kyi lo ma gzhon nu 'am /
analyzed: yang na n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i sde tshan rnams kyi lo ma gzhon nu 'am /
translated: Alternatively, the young leaves of the classes beginning with nyagrodha,

original: yang na de rnams kyi shun lpags kyi phye ma gang yang rung ba khar dang 'o mas sbyar te blud do //
analyzed: yang na de rnams kyi shun lpags kyi phye ma gang yang rung ba khar dang 'o mas sbyar te blud do //
translated: or any suitable powder of their bark, are mixed with sugar and milk and administered.

original: yang na padma la sogs pa'i chu'i nang nas skyes pa'i rtsa ba'i sman rnams bskol ba'i khu ba btsags pa 'bras phye dang kha ras sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na padma la sogs pa'i chu'i nang nas skyes pa'i rtsa ba'i sman rnams bskol ba'i khu ba btsags pa 'bras phye dang kha ras sbyar ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, the decocted juice of the root medicines born in water such as lotus, etc., is strained and mixed with rice and sugar.

original: yang na rtsa ba'i sman de rnams 'o ma dang bskol te btsags la khar dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba'i sman de rnams 'o ma dang bskol te btsags la khar dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Or, those root medicines are boiled with milk, strained, and mixed with sugar and administered.

original: sbrum pa'i kha zas ni thog ma sbrum nas zla ba gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum lon gyi bar du mngar bag dang / bsil ba'i kha zas sbyin no //
analyzed: sbrum pa'i kha zas ni thog ma sbrum nas zla ba gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum lon gyi bar du mngar bag dang / bsil ba'i kha zas sbyin no //
translated: The diet for a pregnant woman is sweet and cooling food given from the beginning of pregnancy for one, two, or three months.

original: zla ba bzhi la bab pa'i tshe ni kha zas mar dang ldan par sbyin no //
analyzed: zla ba bzhi la bab pa'i tshe ni kha zas mar dang ldan par sbyin no //
translated: When four months have passed, give food with ghee.

original: zla ba lnga la bab pa'i tshe ni kha zas zhun mar dang 'o ma dang ldan par sbyin no //
analyzed: zla ba lnga la bab pa'i tshe ni kha zas zhun mar dang 'o ma dang ldan par sbyin no //
translated: When five months have passed, give food with clarified butter and milk.

original: zla ba drug dang bdun la bab pa'i tshe ni thug pa bzang po dang / gze ma la sogs pa'i sman mar ram /
analyzed: zla ba drug dang bdun la bab pa'i tshe ni thug pa bzang po dang / gze ma la sogs pa'i sman mar ram /
translated: When six or seven months have passed, give good soup, or ghee from sesame or other medicinal plants,

original: sngar bstan pas btab pa blud do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pas btab pa blud do //
translated: or what was previously taught.

original: zla ba brgyad pa'i tshe kha zas 'o ma dang ldan par sbyin zhing /
analyzed: zla ba brgyad pa'i tshe kha zas 'o ma dang ldan par sbyin zhing /
translated: When eight months have passed, give food with milk.

original: til mar dang / shing mngar 'o mar bskol te til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa'i bcud mas btang ngo //
analyzed: til mar dang / shing mngar 'o mar bskol te til mar nyi tshe lus pa btsags pa'i bcud mas btang ngo //
translated: Boil sesame oil and sweet wood in milk, and give the essence of the oil that remains after straining.

original: de phan chad kyi kha zas ni thug pa dang / rkang 'gros dang / ri dags skams na gnas pa'i sha khu snum che bas spag cing zos na bzang ngo //
analyzed: de phan chad kyi kha zas ni thug pa dang / rkang 'gros dang / ri dags skams na gnas pa'i sha khu snum che bas spag cing zos na bzang ngo //
translated: After that, food that is good to eat is soup, meat broth from the flesh of animals that move on legs and of wild animals that live in dry places, and oil.

original: de nas byis pa btsas na /
analyzed: de nas byis pa btsas na /
translated: Then, when the child is born,

original: de'i lte ba sor brgyad tsam lus pa bcad de /
analyzed: de'i lte ba sor brgyad tsam lus pa bcad de /
translated: cut the umbilical cord about eight finger-widths long.

original: chu dro 'jam tsam gyis byis pa bkrus la /
analyzed: chu dro 'jam tsam gyis byis pa bkrus la /
translated: Wash the child with lukewarm water.

original: zhun mar dang / sbrang rtsi cha mi mnyam pa mang du sbyar ba cung zad tsam khar gzhug @277b go ;🔽; de nas gser gyi phye ma dang / shu dag dang / sman bramhi dang / aa ru ra dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma zhib mo zhun mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu 'am /
analyzed: zhun mar dang / sbrang rtsi cha mi mnyam pa mang du sbyar ba cung zad tsam khar gzhug @277b go ; ; de nas gser gyi phye ma dang / shu dag dang / sman bramhi dang / aa ru ra dang / ru rta rnams kyi phye ma zhib mo zhun mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba'i lde gu 'am /
translated: Put a small amount of this mixture in the mouth.🔽Then, give a paste made of a fine powder of gold, cumin, brahmi, haritaki, and liquorice mixed with ghee and honey,

original: yang na gser gyi phye ma /
analyzed: yang na gser gyi phye ma /
translated: or a fine powder of gold mixed with the liquid of boiled brahmi.

original: sman bra m+ti bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba las nyung ngu nyung du rgyun du byin na bu de yid gzhungs shing mdog bzang bar 'ong ngo //
analyzed: sman bra m+ti bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar ba las nyung ngu nyung du rgyun du byin na bu de yid gzhungs shing mdog bzang bar 'ong ngo //
translated: If you give this little by little over time, the child will become intelligent and have a good complexion.

original: bud med bu ma byung ba de ni /🔽thog ma bu byung nas zhag gsum mam /
analyzed: bud med bu ma byung ba de ni / thog ma bu byung nas zhag gsum mam /
translated: For a woman who has not given birth,

original: zhag lnga'i bar du til mar ram /
analyzed: zhag lnga'i bar du til mar ram /
translated: three or five days after giving birth,

original: mar khu tshod ran par blud cing /
analyzed: mar khu tshod ran par blud cing /
translated: give a suitable amount of sesame oil🔽or ghee.

original: kha zas snum bag yod pa sbyin no //
analyzed: kha zas snum bag yod pa sbyin no //
translated: Give her oily food.

original: sha ma 'byung du mi btub pa la ni /
analyzed: sha ma 'byung du mi btub pa la ni /

analyzed: na ma sta ma ba ka ya /

analyzed: las rnam pa lnga ni /

analyzed: de dag gi cho ga bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: de la skyug sman mas btang ba'i thabs ni /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu dugs rnam lnga zhes bya ba khyim dron por lus me sa bsro ba dang / rdo bsregs pa'i steng du chu blugs pa'i rlangs pas bdug cing rdul gdon pa dang / nyi tshan gyis bdug pa dang / dugs kyi sman bsros pa'i phur mas dugs bya ba dang /
translated: Then, the five types of steam bath should be applied: warming the body in a warm house, fumigating with the steam of water poured on a heated stone and inhaling the dust, fumigating with sunlight, fumigating with a heated stone, and fumigating with a heated medicinal pill.

original: gos dang / rdo la sogs pa bsros pa'i dugs rnam pa 'di lnga gang yang rung bas lus legs par dros par byas nas gos dron po bskon te /
analyzed: gos dang / rdo la sogs pa bsros pa'i dugs rnam pa 'di lnga gang yang rung bas lus legs par dros par byas nas gos dron po bskon te /

original: skyug sman btang /
analyzed: skyug sman btang /

analyzed: rkub rten pus mor phyin tsam gyi steng du 'dug ste / ae randa'i sdong bu 'am /

analyzed: bya sgro la sogs pa 'jam pos gre ba nas dkrug cing skyug tu gzhug go //

original: de la skyug sman ni /
analyzed: de la skyug sman ni /

analyzed: @280a * // dron por 'og dros kyis gzung ste blud la skyug tu gzhug go / yang na sbyar dug ces bya ba /
translated: Alternatively, the so-called compound poison is

analyzed: 'bras dang til dang / mon sran sde'u gsum bsregs pa'i thug ba /

original: po son cha dang / legs par btsos pa'am /
analyzed: po son cha dang / legs par btsos pa'am /

analyzed: yang na po son cha'i sa bon 'o ma dang sbyar te bskol ba 'am /
translated: Alternatively, the seeds of post-seed fruit may be boiled with milk.

original: yang na pi pi ling la sogs pa'i skyug sman sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa gong du smos pa rnams po son cha'i 'bras bu lnga bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar te dron por 'thungs na snying tshim par skyugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na pi pi ling la sogs pa'i skyug sman sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa gong du smos pa rnams po son cha'i 'bras bu lnga bskol ba'i khu ba dang sbyar te dron por 'thungs na snying tshim par skyugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, the emetics mentioned above, such as long pepper, may be mixed with honey and boiled with the juice of five post-seed fruits. If drunk warm, they will cause vomiting that satisfies the heart.

analyzed: ku ba ro kha ba dang / thang shing dang / dug mo nyung gi 'bras bu dang / kri ta bha tan dang / dha marga ba rnams kyang skyug sman yin te /

original: so sor po son cha dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: so sor po son cha dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be used individually, like the post-seed fruits.

original: de nas skyugs pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: de nas skyugs pa'i rjes la /
translated: Then, after vomiting,

analyzed: mkhris pa byung ba dang / lto dang / snying kha dang / mgo bo yang bar gyur na skyug sman legs pa yin no //

original: de'i mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan ma ni /

analyzed: skyug sman du btang du mi rung ngo //

original: bkru sman btang ba'i thabs ni /
analyzed: bkru sman btang ba'i thabs ni /

analyzed: thog mar mar dang til mar la sogs pa snum bag gang yang rung ba'i 'jam rtsi blud la /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngar bshad pa @280b bzhin du dugs kyis lus bsros te skyug sman btang la /

analyzed: nad gzhi rnams stobs mnyam pa'i lto ni 'bring ste /

analyzed: shing nye rong dang / rgyam tsha dang / ba bla / sga rnams kyi phye ma rtsabs skyur po'am /
translated: The powder of nyero, gyam tsha, and babla,🔽mixed with sour radish or

analyzed: rkang 'gros dang / ri dags skams na gnas pa'i sha'i khu ba gang yang rung ba dang sbyar te btung bar bya'o //

analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i nad yod pa la ni /

translated: the powder of nyero, sweet-tasting medicines, and any suitable medicine that is beneficial for bile diseases, boiled in water, should be used as a purgative.

translated: The paste of pippali, chaga, shing ne’u ring, and roasted barley flour mixed with honey is the best purgative for all diseases of baekan.🔽The purgative called chakdra, which is a warm liquid made by boiling a powder of Arura, Gyam tsha and pippali, is the best purgative for all diseases and should be drunk.

translated: One sang of hags, one sang of shing ne’u ring powder, and two so of pippali powder mixed with honey, if taken as a purgative, will also cure all diseases.

analyzed: de nas 'khrus pa'i rjes la /
translated: Then, after the purgation,

analyzed: bkru sman drags pa'i mtshan ma ni /
translated: The signs of an excessive emetic are

analyzed: na ba dang / brgyal ba dang / gzhang 'brum 'byung ba dang / rlung 'jug pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / sha rjen bkrus pa'i khu ba 'dra ba mthur du 'byung ba rnams yin no //

analyzed: de la bkru sman ni /
translated: The emetic medicine

analyzed: bkru sman ha cang drags pa ni /
translated: If the purgative is too strong,

analyzed: shug pa dang / bu shel tse dang / n'a ga ge sar dang / can dan rnams kyis lus byugs pa dang / lus blugs pa dang btung ba rnams bya'o //
